[{'created': '2013-07-10 16:18:22.000000000', 'message': 'Spelling updates to openstack-security-guide.

Fixes a number of minor spelling issues picked up by running the aspell
en-US dictionary against the guide. Note that although the en-US
dictionary was used I have shied away from fixing issues where the only
cause of issue is en-GB V en-US but rather stuck to what I consider
appear to be clear mistakes.

Change-Id: I0bf73d31edbd0e8c42387716b4358934c78f7306
'}]
commit_message:
Spelling updates to openstack-security-guide.

Fixes a number of minor spelling issues picked up by running the aspell
en-US dictionary against the guide. Note that although the en-US
dictionary was used I have shied away from fixing issues where the only
cause of issue is en-GB V en-US but rather stuck to what I consider
appear to be clear mistakes.

Change-Id: I0bf73d31edbd0e8c42387716b4358934c78f7306

commit_message:
Update README and make it more explicit

This patch updates the README file and makes it explicit that the config
file should be copied into ~/.marconi (which is suppose to be a
directory).

Change-Id: I08a0ad74cca7068197d3cef35000b07c75076012

a block size of 512 when attaching to an instance.

Some back-ends however support other blocksizes (like 4096),
this change add a check from capabilities for physical and logical

commit_message:
Enable setting blocksize on volumes.

Currently libvirt assumes volumes to have
a block size of 512 when attaching to an instance.

Some back-ends however support other blocksizes (like 4096),
this change add a check from capabilities for physical and logical
block_size entries and updates volume meta-data appropriately.

This can then be used by nova virt to determine if it should pass in
non-default block_size info.

Existing metadata was chosen for now mostly to limit the impact
of the change and minimize risks as we'd like to backport this
to Grizzly.

Fixes bug: 1196248

Change-Id: Ie66e4f3709c10a319eadbf5a195d4404dcbb6b75

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names

Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and
tools/test-requires to test-requirements.txt.
These are standard files, and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

Fixes: bug #1179008

Change-Id: Iecf14056de51aed75f8ce46c6ef43f3167d7736d

[{'created': '2013-07-09 15:48:17.000000000', 'message': "Add test for bulk delete of messages

At the moment Marconi doesn't support bulk deletion of messages,
so this is a negative test. We'll update the test later once we
implement bulk delete support.

Change-Id: I223acf0e7a3e02961d0ab6c28ab33faaaae20d35
"}]
commit_message:
Add test for bulk delete of messages

At the moment Marconi doesn't support bulk deletion of messages,
so this is a negative test. We'll update the test later once we
implement bulk delete support.

Change-Id: I223acf0e7a3e02961d0ab6c28ab33faaaae20d35

commit_message:
Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the client.

This patch adds a safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to catch
ConnectionFailure and raise a ConnectionError instead. Future patches will make
the transport catch ConnectionError and handle it correctly instead of
propagating it to the client.

All storage back-end should support this.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I523232a7cefbd00082447403ceb3abada9af6db3

commit_message:
Ensure /var/log/heat/engine.log is owned by heat

If heat-manage db_sync creates the logfile before the
heat engine service then it will be owned by root causing
heat-engine to error.

Fixes bug 1199789

Change-Id: Ib23a0d46ebf354a3293a64215715038497faf5b0

commit_message:
devstack: Add paths specific to XenServer Core

 * XenServer Core keeps its Xapi plugins in a different path to XenServer,
   in order to comply with the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard.

 * XenServer Core mounts devices under /dev/xen/blktap-2 in dom0,
   whereas XenServer mounts them under /dev/sm.

Change-Id: I0a66cd03f000f19c8ff63a8ae4231c00fda88380

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 21:21:28.000000000', 'message': "Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers

Currently there are a mixture of strategies in the v2 and v3 controllers
for how to get the roles assigned for the scope of the requested
authentication.  This duplicates code, is hard to maintain and in at
least once case (where your only roles on a project are due to a group
membership) is not actually correct (for v2 tokens).

This change does the following:

- Standardizes on using the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()', and its
  domain equivalent, for how roles are obtained to build a token.  This
  was already the case for v3 tokens.  The controllers no longer need
  to get metadata and exract the roles.
- Removes the driver level functuon to 'authorize_for_project' - this now
  handled wihin the controller.  The driver simply supports the user
  authentication.

A nice (and planned for) sideffect of the above is that we no longer
expose the schema of how we store roles outside of the driver - i.e.
nothing outside of the driver has to know about how roles are
stored in the metadata.  This paves the way for a re-implementation
of the grant tables in IceHouse.

Implements bp authenticate-role-rationalization

Change-Id: I75fc7f5f728649d40ab1c696b33bbcd88ea6edee

commit_message:
Rationalize how we get roles after authentication in the controllers

Currently there is a mixture of strategies in the v2 and v3 controllers
for how to get the roles assigned for the scope of the requested
authentication.  This duplicates code, is hard to maintain and in at
least once case (where your only roles on a project are due to a group
membership) is not actually correct (for v2 tokens).

This change does the following:

- Standardizes on using the 'get_roles_for_user_and_project()', and its
  domain equivalent, for how roles are obtained to build a token.  This
  was already the case for v3 tokens.  The controllers no longer need
  to get metadata and extract the roles.
- Removes the driver level function to 'authorize_for_project' - this is
  now handled wihin the controller.  The driver simply supports the user
  authentication.

A nice (and planned for) sideffect of the above is that we now hide
the schema of how we store roles within the driver layer - i.e.
nothing outside of the driver (other than any specific-to-implementation
tests) have to know about how roles are stored in the metadata.  This paves
the way for a re-implementation of the grant tables in IceHouse.

This change also fills in missing function definitons in the assignment
driver.

Implements bp authenticate-role-rationalization

Change-Id: I75fc7f5f728649d40ab1c696b33bbcd88ea6edee

commit_message:
Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the
security groups extension and the corresponding unittests
to the v3 framework.

In v3, the management of security groups will be handled
by the networking service API. However, the dis/association
of security groups with instances still needs to be handled
by Nova. This change removes the security group management
code and ports the dis/association code to v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I617eee5660447bc61518b89eed73ce394f7435a2

subject: Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 1

commit_message:
Port security groups extension to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I9cf1fb168283f9c76bac622d20719ac1bf7eb648

commit_message:
PowerVM resize and migrate test cases

Resize and migrate functionality for the PowerVM driver
was landed without tests.

Fixes bug 1133058

Co-authored-by: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I9b46f092ebaab630fe80e0306ea32bda5a4c1d2f

commit_message:
Using new `["openstack"]["mq"]` attributes

Added grizzly rabbbit HA functionality, and switched to the
new mq attributes. Attributes were updated to allow global
and local overrides.

Change-Id: I10f92932fbe1bd256c5a6e10cd357a8ac5e5f1e0

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-10 19:16:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

TBH you should be putting this in your global excludes file. It's not really up to projects to handle every type of editor that might possibly be used by their developers. As a bonus, you won't have to pester every project you ever work on in the future to do this for you.

  printf '*~\n' >~/.gitignore
  git config --global core.excludesfile '~/.gitignore'"}]

[{'created': '2013-07-01 12:54:53.000000000', 'message': 'Set QPID_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode

When deploying OpenStack in a multi-node configuration,
the Qpid clients need the hostname of the potentially
remote Qpid server in order to permit the necessary RPC
communication between components.

Fixes bug #1196521

Change-Id: Iee3c3747cedea9488ec345e78f8eddbc6e850573
'}]
commit_message:
Set QPID_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode

When deploying OpenStack in a multi-node configuration,
the Qpid clients need the hostname of the potentially
remote Qpid server in order to permit the necessary RPC
communication between components.

Fixes bug #1196521

Change-Id: Iee3c3747cedea9488ec345e78f8eddbc6e850573

commit_message:
Cluster scaling validation added

* Added schema
* Checks all posible scaling wrong flows
* Unigied nodegroup basic checks
* Remove validation checks from api functions

Implements blueprint savanna-rest-api-1-0-validation

Change-Id: Ia16300a08cae3edd04c2b06b4154c598b6122cfd

commit_message:
Add EPEL repository to assumptions.

Added EPEL repository to instructions and modified RDO instruction to
use a consistent approach (using the "release" RPM). Also fixed prompt
which erroneously indicated normal user could write to /etc/yum.repos.d.

Fixes bug 1198273

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/35843

Change-Id: I706b74594212a73aeecd229d2fce7f5244f555b3

commit_message:
Ports image_size extension to v3 API

This merges the functionality from the v2 image_size functionality into
the images extension (which is no longer core in v3)

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I577907e671d18712893afcb5477fbd2aa6031956

Don't allow django_openstack_auth 1.1.0

Well awesome work bringing that in, but the bug says:
 etc/heat/heat-engine.conf is missing all the flags related to RPC (RabbitMQ, QPID, ZMQ).
 and you haven't touched that file (heat-engine.conf), so arguably the bug is not fixed? I think all that is left is to manually diff the conf files and merge in the missing options into heat-engine.conf. One thing to look into is the daemons might not have all the same config options. (heat-api will have wsgi options and heat-engine has db options.). (1 inline comment)

This looks fine to me

Does this require any configuration checks to make sure it'll work?"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-27 14:58:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this is missing the volume cleanup, so leaks a volume."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-06-27 15:03:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sean, it is not missing the cleanup, I'm not creating any additional volume... I'm reusing the volume created in setUpClass"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-06-28 02:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-28 15:48:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ok, I got it. Can you just comment on that line then to make it clear when we hunt for leaks in the future that it's a volume reuse, so not needing another cleanup? 

After a comment is added, I'm +2"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-07-03 02:14:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is really confusing to me. It's a volume upload test, but we're using the images client and adding a cleanup that calls the image client delete_image?

Giulio, what am I missing here?"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-04 13:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@jaypipes:
The cinder actually uploads the volume to glance, so the test case deletes the uploaded glance image.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jay, as per Attila comment, this is a feature added in Cinder which allows for a volume to be uploaded in Glance; after the upload we delete the image using the Glance client'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-07-09 20:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A call to delete the volume from Cinder should result in a call to Glance to delete the volume bits from Glance. Under no circumstances should the "normal" behaviour be that a volume is created with the Cinder REST client and then that volume be destroyed using the Glance REST client. That is a just plain wrong...'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-07-09 22:02:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

After chatting with Attila, I now understand the purpose of this call and why it exists. I'm removing my -1 due to the objection about the image service being called instead of the volume service, however, I believe Sean's request for a comment about why the addCleanup() is on the image service and not the volume service has merit. Giulio, please do add a comment saying that the test case is verifying the code paths from the upload-to-image cinder CLI command and that Cinder does not store any information as a result of this call -- only Glance does, and therefore the addCleanup() is only needed for the image service and not the volume service.

Thanks!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-07-10 08:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-10 08:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 08:54:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add new test for the volume upload in Glance functionality

The new test belongs to the _actions endpoints. A new method
"upload_volume" is added in the base volume class to support the
functionality.

Change-Id: I7f9f0e6983199012522d5a398dd7759d9adb7d71
Fixes: bug #1193379

commit_message:
Add cover/ to .gitignore

When we run "tox -e cover" to generate coverage report, testr will make
"cover" directory which contains the same html in "covhtml" made by
"./run_test.sh --coverage".  So, make git ignore this directory.

Change-Id: I829667a1ceb55418a5695545ad543a53f63821ba

commit_message:
Compute using new `["openstack"]["mq"]` attributes

Added grizzly rabbbit HA functionality, and switched to the
new mq attributes.  Attributes were updated to allow global
and local overrides.

Change-Id: I95451012297f1f8f4afdb71f10e703765061dfa4

Removed attributes now handled by `openstack-common`

Now that `openstack-common` handles the `["openstack"]["mq"]`
attributes, there is no need to set them in the default test cases.

commit_message:
Add dbapi functions

1. add get_nodes_by_chassis
2. add chassis_list
3. add tests for new dbapi function
4. remove object created in setUp function in test

We need chassis_list when we get /chassis,
and we need get_nodes_by_chassis when we get /chassis/chassis_id/nodes.

I remove object created in setUp function because the object created in
setUp function will always exist in the db util test is over, so the
result of test_chassis_list will be effected by the object created in
setUp.

Change-Id: Ic2a743b764761935f847de0e0cdb0a2ebcec2486

commit_message:
Remove ubuntu-specific instruction from rpm guide

Though the bug report notes the step is obsolete for grizzly,
it was from the yum/rpm guide, and it was an ubuntu specific instruction

This change modifies the paragraph so the ubuntu-specific instruction is
only shown where it belongs.

fixes bug 1199625

Change-Id: Iba80183bbf140eccaa835cc8a8cc2a123edf444c

commit_message:
Validation added for missed scale/convert impl

It checks that specified plugin supports scale or convert features
before handling scale/convert requests by checking that this functions
has been overridden in plugin.

Fixes bug #1199072

Change-Id: Ifa39da576fe93ca25c19b8776950c44eb2468176

quantum_conf will currently load the quantum
configuration from quantum.conf during prefetch
which leads to an empty quantum_conf and errors

This patch changes quantum_conf to be reloaded
each time it is accessed.

Change-Id: Iff7a1dbb152cb7377f24eb0e51aff5d2224ec107
'}]
commit_message:
Load config on every access

quantum_conf will currently load the quantum
configuration from quantum.conf during prefetch
which leads to an empty quantum_conf and errors
stating the config file is not complete.

This patch changes quantum_conf to be reloaded
each time it is accessed.

Change-Id: Iff7a1dbb152cb7377f24eb0e51aff5d2224ec107

commit_message:

An environment file containing the following:
properties:

Results in the following error:
 File "/home/steveb/dev/localstack/heat/heat/api/openstack/v1/stacks.py",
line 132, in environment

commit_message:
Also accept timeout parameter in FakeMemCache

When fake.cache is set, current master keystoneclient
is setting timeout= parameter instead of time= parameter
in set due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1095730

Change-Id: Ied8ffd6ac9738951d48e74a496a8777928fcc0d9

commit_message:
Run exercise and smoke tests out of grenade.sh

Run the exercises for new/devstack and tempest
smoke tests out of grenade.sh script. Disable those
on grenade and enable in the devstack-vm-gate.
Run without sudo privileges

Implements bp nightly-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I8d3eec455fc6af64441531dc55502087e54e1cc6

commit_message:
Basic cleanup for security guide pdf.

This is the result of a pass over the guide to fix some of the conversion
errors and other minor page layout issues in the pdf generation from the
new docbook source.

I also added company affiliation for the authors list.

Fixes: bug #1199516
Change-Id: I5035d790e29ee17d83f3b4966aa08917278a6870

[{'created': '2013-07-10 13:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19

Fedora 19 cloud images are available here

  http://download.eng.pnq.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/releases/19/Images/x86_64/

Tested the qcow2 image with

  $ disk-image-create -o fedora-19 fedora \
  -a i386 2>&1 | tee /var/tmp/dib-log-f19.txt

Fixes 1199237

Change-Id: If2fb45bd1d528fb52b9c103b211eaf381834019c
'}]
commit_message:
Update Fedora cloud image version from 18 to 19

Fedora 19 cloud images are available here

  http://download.eng.pnq.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/releases/19/Images/x86_64/

Tested the qcow2 image with

  $ disk-image-create -o fedora-19 fedora \
  -a i386 2>&1 | tee /var/tmp/dib-log-f19.txt

Fixes 1199237

Change-Id: If2fb45bd1d528fb52b9c103b211eaf381834019c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 20:01:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix config option network_size typo

The option is network_size instead of network_size_size. When
used in a larger cidr addr to create a network with nova-manage,
this config option is used and a NoSuchOptError is thrown.

Fix bug 1190354.

Change-Id: I08d8a525d1d0cb9fd527fb5e75401f81399d1f82
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config option network_size typo

The option is network_size instead of network_size_size. When
used in a larger cidr addr to create a network with nova-manage,
this config option is used and a NoSuchOptError is thrown.

Fix bug 1190354.

Change-Id: I08d8a525d1d0cb9fd527fb5e75401f81399d1f82

commit_message:
Add cinder CLI tests to tempest

Basic, read-only tests for Cinder CLI client.
Checks return values and output of read-only commands.

Change-Id: Ib1168f40cb8edb4c2ad28155889dc6a7063b16ad
Implements: blueprint cinder-cli-tests

commit_message:
Use auth_token middleware from keystoneclient

auth_token middleware has been moved from keystone to
python-keystonecient in Grizzly, so update api-paste url accordingly.

Change-Id: Ic84f71bd4880a5ccf5421a7e7653595c629d1988

commit_message:
Remove a useless arg in range()

Modify tests/test_backend.py, remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0)
since its default value is 0.

Change-Id: Ia88c538a6dfe751e94fdb7f465ab87ce72cfa108

commit_message:
Adding action based authorization for keypairs.

Added support for action-based policy to keypairs extensions.
Added the same for v3.
Fixes LP 1194739
Change-Id: Ie2a6f7b98845e0789f25c6fd0b97e119d5302046

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-06-21 13:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I understand your point but we need to verify that the json is correct. It is supposed to be a boolean, true in this case. But if the server was buggy and returned the json string 'True' instead of the json boolean true, this test would still pass. Perhaps the assertion logic needs to go in a helper method in the json/xml specific-code."}, {'account_id': 6455, 'date': '2013-06-25 05:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi David,

Yes, you were right. We generally do not add assertion logics in helper methods. We can add conditional logic in test script, that checks the JSON/XML interface and does the corresponding assertion. Else we may raise a bug seeking for boolean true as response and request for XML interface and skip the test case for the same reason. 

Please suggest on how to follow up.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-06-25 14:31:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As commented in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32258/, I think the right thing would be to change the xml client to return a boolean like in json but it may not be possible to do that. I don't have a strong opinion on where the code that does something different for xml/json goes as long it that code only exists in one place. Right now this downcase string thing is done in a whole bunch of places."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-28 15:49:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Quantum -> Neutron rename

Rename all paths to neutron, and almost all file entries,
except some of those in the nova.conf template(these have not been
ported to neutron yet).

This does not "Fix" bug 1199443 more accurately it avoids it. But
a rename would eventually be needed in tripleo anyway so doing
this now means we don't need to find/wait for a fix.

Fixes bug 1199443

Change-Id: I5e61fab1d444d90eb2c54ccfeefca5e148d96996

commit_message:
Fix misc issues with os-multinic v3 API extension

Fixes action names for the extension to be consistent with other
extensions

Replaces WebDav UnprocessableEntity return code with BadRequest
when the client body is bad

Cleanup exception handling

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ied433fe6cf93d6724201035120612036dec53283

commit_message:
Port multinic extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the multinic extension and the corresponding unittests to
the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I5688b66734daa05eb92501f16a8413a194c5fa30

commit_message:
Add "ExtendedVolumes" API extension

- adds an API extension to include list of attached volumes with instance info
- adds v3 api porting as well

DocImpact

Implements blueprint servers-add-volume-list
Change-Id: If58dc40b093c2f61c6ae6b82fcd8f0bf53be464a

commit_message:
Sync IscsiTarget, KeyPair, Migration, Network.

This patch syncs models with migrations for:
- IscsiTarget
- KeyPair
- Migration
- Network

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I00548fb4042a72defb9d1541e7e8ef4d0e1629a8

commit_message:
Try to fix Back button in Create Services window.

Move set_wizard_goto_step() to the place where it is actually taken into resulting html.
Still it crashes after sequence Back, Next.

Change-Id: I54cc1bc6f194a69eadf8fb1fde96622012299505

Custom javascript files

Enables adding custom javascript files from outside of Horizon

Fixes: bug #1195712

Change-Id: I71fab422f3031259379f1c342897dd4e4f6776c8

Why do it? There are blueprints describing the need for this functionality?"}, {'account_id': 6743, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:03:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sergey
While I do understand your concern, I think we need to think ahead.
Currently we have only one backup service which is Swift (cinder/backer/services/swift.py), but soon we will be getting a new Ceph service as seen (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34140/)
Don't you think it would make sense to have all services follow a specific design of what they expose and don't expose. This would allow quick and seamless interchangeability between backup services."}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wanted to used this review to discuss the interface regarding the blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-backup-to-ceph.

So yes there are blueprint about it ;)'}, {'account_id': 7708, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I propose to add a link to blueprint in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-06-24 12:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I also think we should only define an interface that is actually required and currently (even once I add ceph backup) there is only a need for backup() restore() and delete() so I think we should leave it at that for now and add new calls as and when they are required."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-24 13:48:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add interface class for backup drivers

This fix introduces an interface class to define the structure of all backup
drivers. It also renames backup/service to backup/driver.
To be backward compatible a mapping functionality is introduced to map old
backup services to backup drivers.

Implements: blueprint refactor-backup-service

Change-Id: Ic3fca567111f4bd1b221689c73cd5c3bab4a777b

Validation of the gateway IP address was taken place even
if the gateway IP was set to None; this was causing an
AddrFormatError exception to be raised by method
'_validate_gw_out_of_pools'. With this change we skip
the validation in case the gateway is set to None.

Fixes bug #1178273

Change-Id: Ib84378a4fd2cefdbbcacce695abbfaf82c647dd3

commit_message:
Allow gateway address to be unset for an existing subnet

Validation of the gateway IP address was taken place even
if the gateway IP was set to None; this was causing an
AddrFormatError exception to be raised by method
'_validate_gw_out_of_pools'. With this change we skip
the validation in case the gateway is set to None.

Fixes bug #1178273

Change-Id: Ib84378a4fd2cefdbbcacce695abbfaf82c647dd3

commit_message:
Add custom RPC(Des|S)erializer to common/rpc.py

We need a custom way to serialize / de-serialize some types in the rpc
API. Some of this custom serializations are worth moving to Oslo and
other aren't. Before going down that road, it is worth testing them and
make them a bit more stable.

This patch introduces a serializer and a de-serializer for Glance's RPC
API.

Implements blueprint registry-db-driver

Change-Id: I70c429c65d67cbd7ba09176d5f8e4e8f27270c5b

Remove AA from launch cluster dialog

Since we do not populate fields when user selects template, we need to
distribute properties to between cluster and template

Change-Id: Ic201a4dd2db5812be4e2e3512e766740f13c7749

commit_message:
Port user_data API to v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If8075f202800f333753aa571fc3acf5b1a9f4880

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to AgentBuild.

Added unique constraint 'uniq_agent_builds0hypervisor0os0architecture0deleted'
('hypervisor', 'os', 'architecture', 'deleted') to AgentBuild model and
migrate sripts. Added new exception `AgentBuildExists`.
Updated agent_build_create(). Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: I6c41378470230a48773da8082b17699b09785051

quantum-server:
import eventlet
eventlet.monkey_patch()

import os
import sys
sys.path.insert(0, os.getcwd())
from neutron.server import main as server

server()

why do we need eventlet.monkey_patch() in __init__'s main() again()?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-10 08:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

When setup.py is used, neutron-server and quantum-server are installed by setup.cfg instead of copying using bin/quantum-server.

setup.cfg has an entry "neutron-server = neutron.server:main", so we need this patch.

If I remember correctly, Mark said he is planning to remove bin directory. Nova already did so.'}]

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82

commit_message:
Ensure that the neutron server is properly monkey patched

The legacy 'quantum-server' script will apply the eventlet
monkey patch whereas the new 'neutron-server' entry point
does not.  This prevents the server from properly handling
the REST interface.

Fixes bug #1199383

Change-Id: I498d2b02e6018425fc4538eff6803df8971f8e82

v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

[{'created': '2013-07-09 15:27:14.000000000', 'message': "Some corrections to the steps in the README

Changed chmod to allow read/write for 'other'
Removed instruction to run `./redstack start` as this is handled by
`./redstack install`
Added a reminder to save iptables rules
Added `screen -wipe` step to clean stale screen sessions

Change-Id: I72b27730cd285fb62272944dd037bdc4e907fb14
"}]
commit_message:
Some corrections to the steps in the README

Changed chmod to allow read/write for 'other'
Removed instruction to run `./redstack start` as this is handled by
`./redstack install`
Added a reminder to save iptables rules
Added `screen -wipe` step to clean stale screen sessions

Change-Id: I72b27730cd285fb62272944dd037bdc4e907fb14

appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be

commit_message:
Port images metadata functionality to v3 API Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 implementation file into the
appropriate v3 directory unchanged. The copy as-is will not be
loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second
changeset will then make the changes required for it to work as a
v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Note that this functionality will be moved from core to an
extension.  Consensus appears to be that we continue to need this
functionality for v3 because some deployers disable the public
image endpoint due security concerns and whether this will be
fixed in glance for Havana. Deployers can disable this extension
if they do not want it.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I900ff0f93bb790f4f7bbac66bb2437906cb905f5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-29 04:30:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add -R <storage_url> to override used Storage Url.

Adds new option, -R/--storage-url, to bin/swift which can be used to
override the X-Storage-Url returned from the authentication system.
This can be used to bypass a load-balancer to hit a specific proxy
server for testing/debugging purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing a new,
optional kwarg into swiftclient.client.Connection.__init__(),
storage_url_override.

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

Change-Id: Id2a36ed6abffd65e7762b6beea5bbfc6c036e848
'}, {'created': '2013-06-29 08:13:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add -R <storage_url> to override used Storage Url.

Adds new option, -R/--storage-url, to bin/swift which can be used to
override the X-Storage-Url returned from the authentication system.
This can be used to bypass a load-balancer to hit a specific proxy
server for testing/debugging purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing a new,
optional kwarg into swiftclient.client.Connection.__init__(),
storage_url_override.

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

Change-Id: Id2a36ed6abffd65e7762b6beea5bbfc6c036e848
'}, {'created': '2013-07-04 21:27:39.000000000', 'message': "Allow storage url override for both auth vers.

When --os-storage-url is specified on the command-line to bin/swift, it
will override the used storage URL regardless of authentication for both
authentication version 1 and version 2.  This can be used to bypass a
load-balancer to hit a specific proxy server for testing/debugging
purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing the
desired storage URL into swiftclient.client.Conection.__init__() via the
os_options keyword argument.  For example:

  conn = Connection(auth_url, user, key, os_options={
    'object_storage_url': 'http://overridden.storage.url/AUTH_foo'})

openstack/swift.

commit_message:
Allow storage url override for both auth vers.

When --os-storage-url is specified on the command-line to bin/swift, it
will override the used storage URL regardless of authentication for both
authentication version 1 and version 2.  This can be used to bypass a
load-balancer to hit a specific proxy server for testing/debugging
purposes.

Within the client library, this feature is accessed by passing the
desired storage URL into swiftclient.client.Conection.__init__() via the
os_options keyword argument.  For example:

  conn = Connection(auth_url, user, key, os_options={
    'object_storage_url': 'http://overridden.storage.url/AUTH_foo'})

This patch also adds a dependency on mock>=0.8.0, which is the same as
openstack/swift.

Change-Id: Id2a36ed6abffd65e7762b6beea5bbfc6c036e848

commit_message:
Remove suds requirement

Last usage of suds was removed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33168/. suds is
meanwhile unmaintained and has pending security issues,
so better remove references to it.

Change-Id: I7e66a1b6e3a3189b07b30564f7b02f5e195944ff

commit_message:
Basic cleanup for security guide pdf.

This is the result of a pass over the guide to fix some of the conversion
errors and other minor page layout issues in the pdf generation from the
new docbook source.

I also added company affiliation for the authors list.

Change-Id: I7ff863ebd513084fc3e2abf752164f117ac320d9
Fixes: bug #1199516

'}, {'created': '2013-07-03 09:17:36.000000000', 'message': "Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

DB API is an abstraction layer, which is used to make it
possible to switch DB backends easily (though we've got only

commit_message:
Don't pass 'session' arg to public DB API methods

DB API is an abstraction layer, which is used to make it
possible to switch DB backends easily (though we've got only
SQLAlchemy backend at the moment).

Public methods of DB API should not accept any backend-specific
arguments (i. e. a Session instance, that is an SQLAlchemy entity
to work with DB transactions).

This patch removes 'session' argument from all DB API public methods
(except volume_data_get_for_project() and snapshot_data_get_fro_project(),
which are a bit tricky and will be fixed by another patch).

If a DB API method must be called by another one in the context of a started
transaction, a private method is used. It accepts the same arguments as the
corresponding public method plus one additional argument to pass the transactional
context (in case of SQLAlchemy backend it's a Session instance).

Blueprint: db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Iabe7ea834ec07f6520614de2461b9ad1ab7a7ac2

[{'created': '2013-07-09 17:52:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race

A race existed where it was possible two greenthreads to attempt to create a
new info_cache or bw_usage record for a given instance. This would result in a
DBDuplicateEntry exception.

In both of these cases, first-one-wins is an acceptable solution, so we can
swallow the exception safely.

Fixes bug 1199468

Change-Id: Icc81bb013fa9dc142f88adbe4d11cdbd350230cc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix info_cache and bw_usage update race

A race existed where it was possible two greenthreads to attempt to create a
new info_cache or bw_usage record for a given instance. This would result in a
DBDuplicateEntry exception.

In both of these cases, first-one-wins is an acceptable solution, so we can
swallow the exception safely.

Fixes bug 1199468

Change-Id: Icc81bb013fa9dc142f88adbe4d11cdbd350230cc

commit_message:
Fix v3 hypervisor extension search action follow REST principles

The original search action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/search'

It doesn't follow REST principles.

So change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/search?query=[filters]'

This follow the suggestion from
http://www.slideshare.net/apigee/restful-api-design-second-edition#btnNext at 77 pages.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I114868112e0dd719c046853de29df5cfa8dae6b5

commit_message:
Port quota classes extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the quota classes extensions and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Adds quota class id to data returned by update which makes
it consistent with the behaviour of show.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I7ca95e332933872ff20d719bf07dd10364510cbe

commit_message:
Allow graph dependencies to be manually provided.

Instead of always automatically finding dependencies
of tasks it would be nice to allow developers to manually
provide them if they want to. Adjust how dependencies are
located due to this alteration + a few test cases for it.

Change-Id: I61027be7c458cd26b163ca58e703dc413735396c

commit_message:
Update boot-stack vm image for overcloud use.

We now have an undercloud specific template, so we can use
bootstack-vm specifically for the overcloud control plane.

Change-Id: I06eb2b1d00e4d2211b632a06880aed51f01762ff

commit_message:
Make merge.py output deterministic.

The current code uses dictionary sort order which is defined as being
an undefined order. Since humans review .yaml files having them sorted
is a good thing.

Change-Id: I43a31530bc042750448ac904c0c22f9a59b09b4d

commit_message:
Remove boot-stack dependency on cinder

Cinder is not used in all boot-stack environments, only in the
overcloud. We may want to have separate elements to initialise cinder
in the future, but that is speculative. Right now we only know that we
don't need cinder except when building overcloud images.

This was prompted by bug 1199412 occuring.

Change-Id: Ie7485f741aaef67599fb1fa2da381e23b6cbe805

commit_message:
Use the runner interface as the best task lookup.

Instead of having to examine tasks for requires
or provides or optional properties/attributes, have
the runner class do this instead and then have the
flows which use the runner class just access the known
to exist attributes directly.

Change-Id: I2db4ce5296bdbd50e882f5940572a4c513e73d20

commit_message:
Unify creation/usage of uuids.

Instead of using the name it is likely better to
give the flows a uuid and use that for tracking
purposes rather than using the flow name (which
maybe duplicated). Also unify the usage of the
job tracking id -> uuid as well as adjust the
visibility of said uuids (to be read-only).

Change-Id: I592800bd9e08e3a7bde33ff250a454588324f052

commit_message:
Move to using pbr.

The new way to build packages and perform setuptools
interactions seems to be via the pbr library so to
play well with others, use said library.

Change-Id: I519503fdf59457dc554870b8e6ff61613ab30d11

the internal state of the flow when needed
instead of duplicating code that does this.

commit_message:
port Deferred_delete API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I43de158d32c03ffa416699e7f6835a7dbcd9e6bd

[{'created': '2013-07-08 02:27:21.000000000', 'message': 'Misc fixes for v3 evacuate API extension

Miscellaneous fixes for the V3 evacuate API extension:

- Python style attribute naming
- admin_password is no longer an optional return value. If it
  is not set it is returned as None

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ida5da71bddd495880bafd90a578ca95b21319504
'}]
commit_message:
Misc fixes for v3 evacuate API extension

Miscellaneous fixes for the V3 evacuate API extension:

- Python style attribute naming
- admin_password is no longer an optional return value. If it
  is not set it is returned as None

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ida5da71bddd495880bafd90a578ca95b21319504

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings
more rigorously than python2. So use six.text_type, six.u()
where approiate.

Change-Id: I890e19cb857e10f0292aabdaebaa8e7a7bd8db23
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-06-24 16:47:17.000000000', 'message': 'python3: Fix unicode compatibility python2/python3

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings
more rigorously than python2. So use six.text_type/six.u()

Change-Id: I890e19cb857e10f0292aabdaebaa8e7a7bd8db23

commit_message:
python3: Fix unicode compatibility python2/python3

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings
more rigorously than python2. So use six.text_type/six.u()
where appropriate

Change-Id: I890e19cb857e10f0292aabdaebaa8e7a7bd8db23
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 02:32:11.000000000', 'message': "Handle errors raised by extend volume

Errors or exceptions raised by extend_volume in manage.py aren't handled.
This means the volume status will not be updated to 'error_extending' when an
error is raised during the process.

Fix bug #1199471

Change-Id: I1a76c317be6c340d7e21d97ebd35552493fd3842
"}]
commit_message:
Handle errors raised by extend volume

Errors or exceptions raised by extend_volume in manage.py aren't handled.
This means the volume status will not be updated to 'error_extending' when an
error is raised during the process.

Fix bug #1199471

Change-Id: I1a76c317be6c340d7e21d97ebd35552493fd3842

commit_message:
hyperv: Fix vmops.get_info raises InstanceNotFound KeyError

Fixes a problem with the nova.virt.hyperv.vmops.get_info method raising
an InstanceNotFound with the wrong key for the exception message.  Also
adds a test case to make sure it works.

Fixes bug 1197506

Change-Id: I393951ff7bf6e28ce5d7a060cdd0011fe8ecc9ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-21 15:47:37.000000000', 'message': "Optimize some dictionary operations:

1. Remove unnecessary calls to dict.keys(), which creates a new list.
If we don't need the list, just iterate over the dict without
calling keys().

2. When we iterate over a dict's keys and later get the corresponding
value within the loop, instead use iteritems() so that we get the value
when it's already handy, to save an additional hashtable lookup.

Change-Id: Ifa358c6f3d9f8c0ba57466d7ba7d79bb65a152a0
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize some dictionary operations:

1. Remove unnecessary calls to dict.keys(), which creates a new list.
If we don't need the list, just iterate over the dict without
calling keys().

2. When we iterate over a dict's keys and later get the corresponding
value within the loop, instead use iteritems() so that we get the value
when it's already handy, to save an additional hashtable lookup.

Change-Id: Ifa358c6f3d9f8c0ba57466d7ba7d79bb65a152a0

[{'created': '2013-06-29 06:10:20.000000000', 'message': 'Port consoles extension API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I60fd601e28ed69c2597cfc8742b2e17e706e2a1f
'}]
commit_message:
Port consoles extension API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I60fd601e28ed69c2597cfc8742b2e17e706e2a1f

commit_message:
Use ccache to cache all compiles between builds.

Many python extensions are built from source each time an image is
built. Repeating these is wasteful, so ccache is employed to eliminate
that waste. A cache dir outside the chroot is used to speed up
subsequent image builds.

Change-Id: Ib73563ddbe5f3be7454bfc54ab91cedb559a1304

commit_message:
Update apache2 element-deps "os-config-applier" to "os-apply-config"

Fixes error: "ERROR: Element 'os-config-applier' not found in '<Path>'"
when the apache2 element is included.

Fixes bug 1199561
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I74897ef5f367be2da615584ed8c6582831defafd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-10 01:21:13.000000000', 'message': 'Restart keystone in wipe-openstack

Fixes bug 1199568

Depending on the timing on first boot if keystone is started
before os-refresh-config then the file /etc/keystone/logging.conf
will not be in place yet. Causing keystone to fail to start, needing
to be started again after os-config-applier is run but before
init-keystone.

After some recent changes, this is now consistently happening on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ifc979bad0ac351794a12ccda2dd97f277b79721b
'}]
commit_message:
Restart keystone in wipe-openstack

Fixes bug 1199568

Depending on the timing on first boot if keystone is started
before os-refresh-config then the file /etc/keystone/logging.conf
will not be in place yet. Causing keystone to fail to start, needing
to be started again after os-config-applier is run but before
init-keystone.

After some recent changes, this is now consistently happening on Fedora.

Change-Id: Ifc979bad0ac351794a12ccda2dd97f277b79721b

commit_message:
Temporary change the django_openstack_auth requirement

commit_message:
Correct faulty Chef search query

The search returns a Hash, not a list, so we need
to remove the reference to [0] in the memcached_servers
library routine call otherwise you get:

undefined method `[]' for nil:NilClass

in chef-client runs.

Change-Id: I479aca833a2eb80fa2baf3e54809b2edaa713b89

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-23 08:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c
'}, {'created': '2013-05-23 09:05:28.000000000', 'message': 'Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c
'}]
commit_message:
Handle AutoReconnect errors.

AutoReconnect errors are not being handled and so, propagated to the
client. This patch adds a SafeCollection class and a safe_call
decorator. The first is used to wrap collections and then wrap all
callable attributes being accessed through this proxy class with the
safe_call decorator. The purpose of safe_call is to "protect" and retry
write operations in case a ConnectionFailure is caught.

As for read operations, it is recommended to decorate the Controller
method and return the appropriate HTTP Error.

Fixes bug: #1169821

Change-Id: I886a90b5d90e356d6491cdb62356e875bee0866c

subject: Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-22 19:16:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/30150/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-2.6/17 : SUCCESS in 32s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30150/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-2.7/17 : SUCCESS in 30s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30150/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-3.0/17 : SUCCESS in 26s
- http://logs.openstack.org/30150/1/check/gate-puppet-horizon-puppet-unit-3.1/17 : SUCCESS in 28s
'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-05-23 05:20:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To the best of my knowledge, /etc/httpd/conf/ports.conf is specific to puppetlabs-apache and isn't part of RedHat Apache packages. People using an older version of puppetlabs-apache (0.6.0) but still the latest available on Puppet Forge, won't be able to use puppet-horizon.

If we are planning on supporting the latest version of puppetlabs-apache module (which isn't released yet), we should:
- Update the Modulefile to require the latest version. (but we can't because there's no release on Puppet Forge yet)
- Use apache::listen define to manage the Listen directive instead of file_line

For now, I don't see any valid solutions which would satisfy the above points and allow a release of this module to Puppet Forge."}, {'account_id': 7208, 'date': '2013-05-23 05:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Perhaps the proper fix for this problem is to note it in a "known issues" doc along with the module release, saying something to the effect of "If you're running puppetlabs-apache >= 0.6.0, make these specific changes".'}, {'account_id': 7208, 'date': '2013-05-31 19:05:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This patch is only relevant to an unreleased version of puppetlabs-apache; when they release a new version and we try to upgrade to it, I'll reintroduce it."}, {'account_id': 1918, 'date': '2013-07-09 22:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-09 22:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Although this change is abandoned, it should use latest puppetlabs-apache version (0.7.0) that just got released.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-22 18:54:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config

The horizon module adds a "Listen" directive to $httpd_listen_config_file,
which was httpd.conf. Since the apache module puts _its_ Listen
directive in ports.conf, there were two Listen directives which
caused httpd to fail to start.

Change-Id: Idaac1b3038a36d1908063b57487951ce8edb5862
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for duplicate Listen directive in horizon apache config

The horizon module adds a "Listen" directive to $httpd_listen_config_file,
which was httpd.conf. Since the apache module puts _its_ Listen
directive in ports.conf, there were two Listen directives which
caused httpd to fail to start.

Change-Id: Idaac1b3038a36d1908063b57487951ce8edb5862

subject: Allow forcing the use of requested_networks
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-07-09 16:48:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Would this be better as a new option (--force) on the v3 API rather than changing the v2 API and adding a new config value?'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:02:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Matt: Yeah that's a reasonable idea. I guess the main issue is, some providers (Rackspace if I had to pick on out of a hat ;-), are going to be running v2 for a while.

That said, if no other providers are going to benefit from this change, then we can make an internal change to support this."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think this is a good way to do it - as Matt already points out.

It would be best for providers who want to add their own extensions to namespace them and their parameters. 

Another 1/2 of -1 for adding another conf option which I think we should avoid as much as possible."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-09 17:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Allow forcing the use of requested_networks

Providers may be using network extensions besides `os-networks`. This allows
them to handle requested networks POST data even if `os-networks` is disabled.

Fixes bug 1199442

Change-Id: Ib8ac78dcbe4f7d5a07fb5ea59507b603716d7435

commit_message:
Change default port for savanna api to 8386.

Since 8080 (the current default) is likely to be used
by other things.  Choose a new unassigned port as the
default.

Change-Id: I8bee3d880167e19810d06e7740842e930f06f9fb
Fixes: bug 1199226

commit_message:
Update bootstack-vm to match undercloud.

Also add Makefile stanza to produce overcoud.yaml from bootstack-vm
and nova-compute-group. This should allow independent usage of
nova-compute-group without having to manually update overcloud.

Change-Id: Id2bd20596e6be887b55019fdad31e6b0f4762eb7

commit_message:
Update nova-compute-instance URL.

Heat must download nested stack templates from a static URL. We
have chosen a reasonable default, the official repository for
tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I9f8f1f3d3ec6492cf3891fab4fe793e05e703eb5

commit_message:
Fixed test - segmented upload of file

The manifest file should be empty. Previously, the data were saved into the
manifest file too, which could cause a false positive.
See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_large_objects.html

Made each segment different, not just data*10.

Change-Id: I6f5a10f2836d6c5d881486d29fc5714213ea4dc5

commit_message:
Fix launching of BfV instances

Fixes LP bug #1047568

Don't explicitly set volume size to 0, rather use the default from
nova.compute.api.API._volume_Size (currently 0, too :-) Also expose
properly in the UI.

Change-Id: I94e72a39d81ee8a7ebeebcac950cf7296372ca91

'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-05-29 04:43:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

So I missed the Horizon-Heat session at the design summit, but after running this, I'm not sure this really makes sense as a horizon workflow.

Workflows in Horizon are maybe oddly named, since they're essentially just a wrapper that allows a single form to have multiple tabs. A user can edit bits of the form on any tab in any order they like before they submit the form.

I think this Heat workflow is a bit different in that you need the template uploaded before anything else can happen. At the moment it's confusing that you can click on the second tab but it's empty, and then when you click Next you get a bunch of form errors on that same tab.

It feels like the first step should be a separate form that then launches the dynamic form. You have the problem of passing the template between forms, but I'd rather solve that than try to fit this into a Horizon workflow, unless we plan to make more changes to how workflows work."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-05-29 04:57:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I think Gabriel intends to enhance workflows to properly handle this use case. I believe also that handling this use case was part of the original intention of workflows when they were written, but it hasn't actually been needed until now."}, {'account_id': 7714, 'date': '2013-06-03 16:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Implementation of a Heat stacks UI.

This change implements a UI to launch, manage and delete Heat stacks.

The launch screens are implemented with a set of chained forms where
the second form is dynamically built from the template in the first step.

A significant portion of this change was derived from
the work Dan Radez <dradez@redhat.com> did on thermal:
https://github.com/steveb/heat-horizon

UX flow revisions and basic test cases by Gabriel Hurley.

Implements blueprint: heat-ui

Change-Id: I294e93bed6da9dd3553e8b4a6a1c09b7c165a555

commit_message:
Allow use of oslo.config-1.2.0a3

See bug #1194807

We add a new dev-requirements.txt file because we don't want anything
not released to pypi to show up with the openstack pypi mirror which
is built from requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt.

Neutron and oslo-incubator already uses oslo.config 1.2.0a2. Nova used
it briefly but we hit an issue.

1.2.0a3 contains a fix for a regression in the registration of the oslo
namespace package, so it doesn't make sense to allow a2.

Change-Id: I6f3eb5fd2c75615d9a1cae172aed859b36b27d4c

I have one inline question, but also, should we add a change to glance.db.sqlalchemy.api update image path to show how we are expecting the location object to look like. Also maybe some test showing example of call to db api. I like this idea I think it applies to image table too, that way we can store more complex metadata for the image that will help with activation logic"}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-06-13 03:54:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@David Peraza, IMO, we store metadata to location table is enough but not need it for image table, since: 1. for those 'common' metadata of an image, it can be sotred into 'image_properties' table, I conside it was designed for store that. 2. for those location related metadata of an image, it should be stored into 'image_locations' table. So, for the complex activation logic support you moentioned, you/user should store the customized key/value to 'image_properties' table as the image property."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-06-13 14:54:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

thanks for response Zhi Yan Liu	that is what we do today, but for example, we have stored properties with json or more comples json with xml text and that makes a bit harder, we need to worry about escape chars and such. We could always mime encode that, but it would be nice to store as pickle object we can just unpickle without worry about escape and double escape etc. Did not mean to discuss this right on this patch but if folks don't mind i'm fine with it."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-17 17:43:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

After reviewing the patch that uses this new location metadata, I have to say I'm not in love with using "anything pickleable" as the storage format. The dependent branch looks like it will print out in the api any python object that is json-serializable as the metadata, so None, strings, ints, dicts, lists, etc. Is there any way for us to more forcefully restrict location metadata to be "just" a particular type of format? Enforcing it as a dictionary, like image properties, seems like it could enforce more sanity.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-05 17:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-05 18:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

commit_message:
Add location specific information to image locations db

This patch adds a column to the image_locations table.  The column
will store location specific information.  As a location is added
to an image there may be some meta data about that information that
needs to be stored with it.  For example, if it is a file:// URL,
information about the NFS server (host name, mount point) would be
needed in order for the URL to be useful.

blueprint: direct-url-meta-data
blueprint: multiple-image-locations

Change-Id: I6a96163abc8e4388e84cae2a8952f89d433210ff

commit_message:
Remove endpoint.name attribute from v3 manager (bug 1191152)

This also provides backwards compatible support for any clients that
were specifying a name by handling it through **kwargs.

Change-Id: I49c542c52e1cdfde5fff1be46d658a805d233320

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 08:06:09.000000000', 'message': 'Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready

Just b/c the glance service has started correctly does not
mean the service is actually running. Often, the service
is not operational and attempts to use the glance_image provider
results in connection errors.

This commit inserts code that allows the glance provider to
sleep for 10 seconds and perform a single retry.

The template for the code and tests was borrowed from keystone.

Change-Id: I565f1befea6ec3d2347f8e29c9aa05d5a312a827
'}]
commit_message:
Glance provider should retry once when service is not ready

Just b/c the glance service has started correctly does not
mean the service is actually running. Often, the service
is not operational and attempts to use the glance_image provider
results in connection errors.

This commit inserts code that allows the glance provider to
sleep for 10 seconds and perform a single retry.

The template for the code and tests was borrowed from keystone.

Change-Id: I565f1befea6ec3d2347f8e29c9aa05d5a312a827

'}, {'created': '2013-07-03 09:39:50.000000000', 'message': 'Allow Keystoneclient 0.3.x

python-keystoneclient recently tagged 0.3.0, which
provides the v3 auth client. Raise upper bound to 0.4.
Also raise lower bound to 0.2.1, which is needed for

commit_message:
Allow Keystoneclient 0.3.x

python-keystoneclient recently tagged 0.3.0, which
provides the v3 auth client. Raise upper bound to 0.4.
Also raise lower bound to 0.2.1, which is needed for
keystone (blueprint ec2signer-to-keystoneclient commit).

Change-Id: I8aef60612bc8c6972ec0aa833724d3382f909d97

P.S. you should just use the correct Change-Id from the previous change request."}, {'account_id': 8090, 'date': '2013-07-09 20:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

[{'created': '2013-07-02 22:18:32.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "docfix apache2 now supports client chunked encodin"

This reverts commit 68cb91097b75a92237bd90caffcd405c3e83cb53

Just so this is not get forgotten in the tree...

We are using daemon mode and chunked is not supported in this mode.'}]
commit_message:
Revert "docfix apache2 now supports client chunked encodin"

This reverts commit 68cb91097b75a92237bd90caffcd405c3e83cb53

Just so this is not get forgotten in the tree...

We are using daemon mode and chunked is not supported in this mode.

commit_message:
Allow router route update in XML.

Fixes: bug 1198188

Router updates of routes in XML format fails.
This patch fixes that problem. It also executes
unit tests for XML-based requests to update
router routes.

Change-Id: Ie65e889a29a3ca9242593d51587de60c8d97e055

commit_message:
Fix for Cisco plugin sample config.

This commit fixes the Cisco plugin's sample config included with Neutron to change all instances
of quantum within the config to neutron.

Change-Id: I80a8b69816ad964ee9761a214aaa5e81e596d501
Fixes: Bug #1199160

commit_message:
use tenant:* as swift r/w acl

The related swift patch has been merged
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22820/), so Glance here could support
this multi tenant sharing feature.

fixed bug #1155389

Change-Id: I36dfc7bdae133149e38e8266666e70cc07490554

commit_message:
Export just the volume metadata for the database to be populated

Change I8c01ba3 retrieved the metadata from Cinder, however it did
not format the output correctly resulting in the metadata being lost
between Cinder and Nova.

This patch fixes Bug 1175571 correctly, ensuring that metadata is
transferred from Glance images to Cinder Volumes and on to Nova
instances.

Change-Id: Ie3a688e6bff539e09ec705ed901534f5829cf167

Use oslo.sphinx and remove local copy of doc theme

Use the new oslo.sphinx version of the OpenStack doc
theme instead of copying it into this repo.

blueprint oslo.sphinx

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Update cinder root-wrap config

Fixes bug 1197048

Installs link to cinder-rootwrap and uses the
rootwrap filters from cinder repository. Without these
cinder fails to run any rootwrap commands.

Change-Id: Ibf6dc4b8db7909b4b95efdc1c8090391c226e8a7

[{'created': '2013-07-09 18:20:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder

Fixes bug 1199412

os-svc-install hasn't yet been installed so can't be used
specifically /opt/stack/venvs hasn't been created and virtualenv
isn't installed.

This commit will fix the problem building a image but bug 1197048
still exists, causing
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh/post-configure.d/72-cinder
to fail.

Change-Id: I3acc2c8b2304933634aeabf869bfed83c6135c9b
"}, {'created': '2013-07-09 18:20:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder

os-svc-install hasn't yet been installed so can't be used
specifically /opt/stack/venvs hasn't been created and virtualenv
isn't installed

This commit will fix the problem building a image but bug 1197048
still exists, causing
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh/post-configure.d/72-cinder
to fail

Change-Id: I3acc2c8b2304933634aeabf869bfed83c6135c9b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove usage of os-svc-install to install cinder

Fixes bug 1199412

os-svc-install hasn't yet been installed so can't be used
specifically /opt/stack/venvs hasn't been created and virtualenv
isn't installed.

This commit will fix the problem building a image but bug 1197048
still exists, causing
/opt/stack/os-config-refresh/post-configure.d/72-cinder
to fail.

Change-Id: I3acc2c8b2304933634aeabf869bfed83c6135c9b

commit_message:
Python 3.x compatibility fixes

Mechanical translation of the easy-to-fix Python 2.x->3.x
compatibility issues. Should work with all Python versions
>= 2.6.

Change-Id: I693ff5d72b2db8d9d3a3347f70f22290897e9cff

commit_message:
Make sure periodic cleanup of instances continues on error

If an instance cleanup fails with an exception, no more instances
will be cleaned up. If the failure is permanent, this will block
other instances from being cleaned up for as long as it remains.

Resolves bug 1192712.

Change-Id: Ibdd69817ee0e6d0963637f38a8be3949e6e053ed

commit_message:
Disable describing of instances using deleted tags as filter.

Previously, one could retrieve instances using a deleted tag
filter that was once associated to the instance. The current change
disables describing instances via a deleted tag.

fixes bug #1197242

Change-Id: I2259594643ecdcf32c10c91c6585bd90bb768527

commit_message:
Implement grace period for claimed message lifetimes

This commit adds a grace period to claims such that claimed
messages are guaranteed not to expire before the claim
itself expires, plus an additional "grace" number of
seconds.

This provides fudge room so that when one worker crashes,
an alternate worker has some time to reclaim the orphaned
messages once they are released from the stalled claim.

Change-Id: Id0e194a85e67f20babfb97e441e11703d6bf5563
Implements: blueprint claimed-message-grace

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 00:20:58.000000000', 'message': "Update kombu dependency to >2.4.7

* Kombu in the Guest needs to be updated to newer version, that
  has support for heartbeats.  The version in apt unfortunately
  does not.
* An additional dependency to the 'six' package is introduced
  by recent updates to oslo rpc

Change-Id: I2cfae4dc67cd7befabfc494222600fabd90bfab8
"}]
commit_message:
Update kombu dependency to >2.4.7

* Kombu in the Guest needs to be updated to newer version, that
  has support for heartbeats.  The version in apt unfortunately
  does not.
* An additional dependency to the 'six' package is introduced
  by recent updates to oslo rpc

Change-Id: I2cfae4dc67cd7befabfc494222600fabd90bfab8

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-03 18:58:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(22 inline comments)

You need to add a policy for this extension, I think we are moving away from the db level checks (think about many levels of admins, etc).

You need to version your change to the cells api. 

Not sure I quite like the API, it seems a bit arbitrary. Would we be better having something that returns migrations, but offers the option of what state you filter the migrations by, and maybe what project you filter them buy.

The way you dispact the request to the cells doen't seem right. I will let the cells experts tell you what should be done. Compute.API is correct, it just think the cells_compute api should simply see if should be its-se"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-03 20:06:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

Overall I have the same impression as John.  The api and mechanism for what you're trying to do don't feel quite right.

I think it makes sense to be able to specify certain properties that you would like to filter by.  These fall into two general categories, state of migration and area where it occurred.  A default filter for in progress migrations makes sense, but shouldn't be limited to that state.

As for as area of migration, you've used cell_name as a target rather than a filter.  I think you should take a look at using a BroadcastMessage for retrieving migration data and filtering it at that point.  I think broadcast should be used as little as possible but in this case it seems to be the right approach.  Of course, comstud may have a better suggestion.  Also, as John mentioned, host is another useful filter.

Overall I see this being most useful if it allows for expressing something like 'I want all migrations in progress or waiting for confirmation in cell2' or 'across the entire environment.'

That's a broad scope and doesn't necessarily need to happen all at once, but it would be best if nothing in this change prevented that from happening later."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-03 20:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Adding Behrens for his opinion on BroadcastMessage'}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-03 22:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

John/Andrew,

Agreed about the API. It should fetch all migrations with an ability to filter the migrations by status or cell. Will do the changes.'}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-03 23:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-03 23:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-04 14:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-04 17:17:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Hi Andrew,

I dint quite get why we should use broadcast over target. In this case I would be interested in getting migrations for a given cell, then wouldn't it be redundant to fetch migrations across all the cells and filter. In this case I would still look at cell_name as a filter from the API point of view, but using a type of message is more of the implementation.

Agreed that from the clients perspective I should be able to fetch all migrations across a region or cells and also have the flexibility to filter the results using host, status or cell_name. Will do the necessary changes."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-06-04 17:26:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Mahesh, I was looking at Broadcast to resolve the inconsistency between a cells and non cells deployment.  If you fetch migrations without specifying a filter then:

In a non cells deployment you will get all migrations

In a cells deployment you will get no migrations.

A client shouldn't care, or really even know, if cells is being used or not.  Not specifying a filter should be equivalent in both cases."}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-04 17:33:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Andrew, it was a basic mistake from my side. Dint really think through the scenario where we don't specify cell_name in a cell setup. Thanks for pointing this out.

Chris Behrens hasn't commented yet on using Broadcast, will wait for his comments and get back to you.

Thanks again."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-06-04 18:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

I share most of the same opinions as past reviewers.  There should be some policy check in the API extension.  I don't like this 'target' thing at all.  I suppose it can be converted into 'filters'... where 'cell_name' is optional and makes sense for cells.  An optional 'state' could also be supported for filtering.

As far as talking to cells, I think that filtering a specific cell should be optional.  The default behavior for non-cells will be to "give me a list of all migrations in progress".  That behavior should be the same for cells.  This means you need to broadcast to all cells and get the responses.  You can see an example of how to do this with the cells call of 'compute_node_get_all'.'}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-05 03:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7393, 'date': '2013-06-11 10:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-11 11:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
List migrations through Admin API

The os-migrations extension exposes endpoint to fetch all migrations.
The migrations can filtered by host and status. If cells are
enabled migrations can be listed for all cells or can be filtered for a
particular cell.

The route for fetching migrations for
a region is - v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations. Filters can be passed as
query parameters -
v2/{tenant_id}/os-migrations?host=host1&status=finished&cell_name=Child

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id70dbece344a722b2dc8c593dd340ef747eb43d3
Implements: blueprint list-resizes-through-admin-api

'}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-06-26 07:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

My only concern here would be the speed overhead on large installations, but this approach is definitely the correct thing to do.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 13:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's a good point. The worst-case (metadata is returned for each instance) is O(n^2/2). I can add a uid to instance dict that should reduce that to O(n)."}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 15:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7629, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:35:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Hang on, I've got one more fix to go in. I realized that if you set a policy where get_all_instance_metadata is more liberal than get_all, this won't quite work. 

I'll elevate the context when calling get_all to avoid this."}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

Which I then forgot to run PEP8 checks against and went over the line length.  Patch set 4 coming in a sec.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

And out of two calls I elevated the wrong context.  Patch Set 5 (for reals) coming soon.'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 17:02:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Eh, no, I should go back to non-elevated context for get_all. There's code that explicitly filters out by user_id and project_id when that's invoked in a non-admin context.

I think openstack should go back and revisit this at some point -- I'd expect this to be controlled by the policy and not hard-coded, but that's a larger issue than this patch."}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-26 17:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-26 18:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/33782/5/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/13067 : FAILURE in 21m 01s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/33782/5/check/gate-nova-pylint/14897 : SUCCESS in 10m 28s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-06-29 05:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-06-29 07:47:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This is obviously the right thing to do, I'm still a little concerned about performance on large sites, but I don't see a way around it easily."}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-06-29 20:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

We need to check N metadata chunks, so I think O(N) is the best we can do with the current policy implementation. Maybe if the policy was integrated with the db we could do better (but maybe not).'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-07-02 20:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It needs tuning and it broke one of the db unit tests, but is this a better approach?

https://github.com/holzman/nova/commit/a013979a4dc2065541c8f5efae62eea50529ea60'}, {'account_id': 6661, 'date': '2013-07-08 17:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-08 18:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Add policy checking to compute.api.get_all_instance_metadata

Retrieves all the instance metadata and the list of instances, and
then checks the policy for each metadata against the matching instance.

Fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: I5c4542250c784a868c6cb16a21823eab7b98fc63

Change from quantum to neutron on upgrading

Upgrade files were pointing to lib/quantum and
quantum funcions on devstack. Change to neutron

Blueprint bp/nightly-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: I136cd8e335e317a426e6a882fd154c8fd5d40a22
