commit_message:
Port admin-actions API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I11fd86cffb45851006338f8b6d2f87dad3aef467

subject: xenapi: Tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks

> So this doesn't quite fix all the issues for the bug. I think you need to look at the other uses of Popen in utils.py and xenstore.py

There are no other Popen calls using shell=True."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-06-27 08:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It was the string splitting that I was worried about, and we should probably make everything use the same call to Popen if we can, they all seem to share slightly different ones.

>The XenApi drivers split a string to create an array for subprocess.Popen, rather than passing an array directly. This invites the potential for command injection / manipulation.
>
>There is no clearly valid reason to use string splitting here when arguments can be passed, as elsewhere, directly into Popen.'}, {'account_id': 7952, 'date': '2013-06-27 17:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7952, 'date': '2013-06-27 17:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

@Dan:

As Mate pointed out, we can't use openstack.common.processutils::execute() because it isn't available in dom0.

We also can't use CalledProcessError because it isn't available in Python 2.4, which is what we run in dom0.

Would you please reconsider your -1?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-07-01 13:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-06-26 16:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Do not spawn a shell to run xe commands in xenhost Xapi plugin

 * Remove shell=True parameter from Popen call in _run_command, and
   change calls to _run command to pass lists of arguments instead of
   single strings
 * Merge _run_command_with_input into _run_command, as after the first
   change the functions were almost identical

Change-Id: Idcdb50bededf0acde92f1774d6752043ba8f97ce
Fixes: bug #1074087
'}, {'created': '2013-06-27 17:42:05.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Consolidate and tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks

 * Rewrite xenhost._run_command and xenstore._run_command to use
   utils.make_subprocess and utils.finish_process
 * Change exception raised by utils.finish_process to retain information
   needed by calls in xenhost and xenstore

Change-Id: Idcdb50bededf0acde92f1774d6752043ba8f97ce
Fixes: bug #1074087

commit_message:
xenapi: Tidy up Popen calls to avoid command injection attacks

 * Rewrite xenhost._run_command and xenstore._run_command to use
   utils.make_subprocess and utils.finish_process
 * Change exception raised by utils.finish_process to retain information
   needed by calls in xenhost and xenstore

Change-Id: Idcdb50bededf0acde92f1774d6752043ba8f97ce
Fixes: bug #1074087

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag

with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to

commit_message:
Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: Ie3de2504fe08f751dbf3f06e4973716a51d7e25b

commit_message:
Move mysql_engine option to [database] group

We can not move the remaining db-related options to the [database] group
because they are defined in oslo-incubator.

sqlalchemy/models.py incorrectly sets options as default.
That's why we need to move mysql_engine to [database] group

Fixes: bug #1193499

Change-Id: Ic485fb28279e5ceeed6e21b4dee2a37a9eea6d6c

commit_message:
Port extended-server-attributes API into v3 part2

Ports the extended-server-attributes extension and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

commit_message:
Ensure flake8 tests run on all api code

We need to exclude the plugins/xenserver directory
because the python2.4 code can't use as in except clauses.
The existing exclude directory accidentally included some
code in nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins and the related
tests. This code is now included in the flake8 tests,
and the current violations have been fixed up.

Fixes bug 1197858

Change-Id: Ib5f1b65d5d793f0f5854e898ca3ce751e43ef233

Ok this appears to address my race concerns. Thanks for fixing it up.'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-07-02 13:31:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry for raising the question so late, I still don't quite understand how IP could be re-released ?"}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-07-02 18:36:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yufang, 

That comment is confusing and wrong. It should say to prevent the IP from getting re-leased. I'll update the comment in a new patch set shortly.

The overall race is that given that the async nature of DHCP we were concerned that there might be a race between a DHCP packet sent by the host immediately before termination and the release packet.

By tearing down the network first we guarantee that no new leases can be issued if they come in. We can then send the release to clear the dnsmasq lease cache, and finally check for any orphaned IPs."}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-07-02 18:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-02 19:53:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

[{'created': '2013-06-27 07:45:00.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly disassociate fixed ip that is not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c

commit_message:
Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c

commit_message:
Xenapi shutdown should return True if vm is shutdown

clean and hard shutdown vm methods return a False if the vm
is currently shutdown. It should return a True, so that its
return value can be used to determine if the vm is shutdown
or not.

Fixes: bug #1195587
Change-Id: I758c43d45b15c3ef231e9eee3ecac620a44db824

commit_message:
Ignore any exceptions from rpc.cleanup().

When shutting down a service, we don't care what exceptions might occur
when doing rpc cleanup, so just ignore them.

Change-Id: I8f12cbb129769f78452ed3cb613f485d4712eaf7

commit_message:
Fix extent size issue when creating thin pool.

The LVM create thin pool rounds up extents, this
change rounds the free space down to an int to avoid
this issue and also cleans up some comments and
code around how PV's are set up and used.

Change-Id: I725aa819c21c38f464595d0146d6640ecd1e6440

subject: Fix exception arg typo
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-07-01 20:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks fine.

commit_message:
Fix exception arg typo

The log message for the RpcVersionCapError exception expects a parameter
called version_cap, not version.  Fix this argument to match.

Change-Id: Iacc4de46b14e9df10250e5ace52b266623fdc3e4

commit_message:
First commit of Galera/MySQL for HA

This is the first commit of instructions for configuring MySQL
and Galera for database high availability.  It includes general
configuration information but may not be complete.

bug #1091889
blueprint improve-high-availability-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 05:24:10.000000000', 'message': 'port Service API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ia44030ac56cb09e4303900a178194127ae8e9a31
'}]
commit_message:
port Service API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ia44030ac56cb09e4303900a178194127ae8e9a31

commit_message:
Define behaviour for properties with None values.

Now that Ref and Fn::GetAtt might return None values, behaviour for
properties with None values needs definition.

This change will treat a None value in the following way:
- if there is a default in the schema, that value will be used
- otherwise a default is used depending on the type ('', False, 0, [] {})

Fixes bug: #1192142

Change-Id: I59ae32c1c32b1bfede7d775aa845cd14246040e1

This change is required for future works in the SolidFire driver.
New SolidFire features (such as extend) are only available in
the latest version of the SolidFire API.

Default to '1.0' for backward compatibility. SolidFire still supports

commit_message:
Add ability to specify SolidFire API version

This change is required for future works in the SolidFire driver.
New SolidFire features (such as extend) are only available in
the latest version of the SolidFire API.

Default to '1.0' for backward compatibility. SolidFire still supports
the '1.0' version in its latest release.

Change-Id: I93590ab297d746d65a58f9166d160d0c1d833014

Any exception handler that has a yield in it is vulnerable to this issue and there already a number of bugs raised on this across all services in Openstack. Version 0.13 of python-eventlet has been released and fixes this issue so there is no point patching code that is being affected by a bug that exists in a third party package for which a fix has been releaed. There is also no point patching one occurrence when there are known to be others.

If you are being affected by this issue, update your python-eventlet package and it will go away. If there are changes in this patch that are not directly related to the eventlet bug please seperate them and create a new patch or rename this one accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-07-08 17:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Refactor reschedule in exception handling of volume manager

Previous exception handling has a pitfall that may potentially clear
the sys.exc_info() (by calling SQLalchmey to update db). This patch
refactors some part of exception handling in create_volume() to make
sure sys.exc_info() is retrieved so that we can log and reraise it;
also we make sure exception be reraised at the end of exception handling
no matter the request is rescheduled or not.

As a side effect, we fixed a bug in unittest which didn't provide
correct argument to db API but previously this exception has been wrongly
consumed by volume manager's exception handling (not reraise exception
when request is rescheduled).

fix bug: 1197648

Change-Id: Idce5d06f8be1fb6018012503ec7f844898a21b25

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 01:24:41.000000000', 'message': "SolidFire API RequestID is useless.

The SolidFire API can take an int or a string for a request-id,
when using an int however it needs to actually be a valid int.

The driver currently was doing an int(uuid) which is too large and
as a result get's truncated making it difficult or impossible to track
request-ids.

This patch chanes the generate request-id to form a hash of the uuid so
that it can be tracked.

Fixed bug: 1199198

Change-Id: I38d5e3d189e679678898c329a9fa173a47853d47
"}]
commit_message:
SolidFire API RequestID is useless.

The SolidFire API can take an int or a string for a request-id,
when using an int however it needs to actually be a valid int.

The driver currently was doing an int(uuid) which is too large and
as a result get's truncated making it difficult or impossible to track
request-ids.

This patch chanes the generate request-id to form a hash of the uuid so
that it can be tracked.

Fixed bug: 1199198

Change-Id: I38d5e3d189e679678898c329a9fa173a47853d47

Recently https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32333/ has been merged. 32333 allows us to specify non-cidr address in the address field like 10.0.0.1/24. On the other hand, this review rejects non network address and suggests a network address is specified. These two changes conflict with each other.

If we allow non network address for cidr such as 10.0.0.1/24, is this patch still needed?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

My bad! Thanks for noticing it. Anyway, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/32333/ is not sufficient.
We need to revert 32333 and merge your patch, or keep 32333 and convert to network address internally.
What do you think? Honestly I don't have strong opinion on it."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
validate and recommend the cidr

Bug #1195974

It is hard to validate the CIDR typed in by user,
the simple way is to recognize only one and recommend it
if user's input is not the one.

Change-Id: Ic8defe30a43a5ae69c3f737094f866b36bb68f59

commit_message:
Check duplicate names between params and resources

make sure there are no duplicate logical names across parameter
and resource definitions

Fixes bug #1196491

Change-Id: I353b84dd8b9bfe77b214e93cc9f1a080ebe2248b

[{'created': '2013-07-03 23:57:39.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce password requirement on stack create/update.

Password needs to be supplied whenever user credentials are stored,
which is during stack create and update.

Some users have been relying on their auth token to perform all heat
operations (as all other openstack services support) however this has
led them to experience obscure errors when wait handles or alarms are
triggered.

Failing early with a clear error message will stop this class of errors.

Fixes bug: #1194303

commit_message:
Enforce credentials requirement on stack create/update.

Credentials need to be supplied whenever they are stored with the stack,
which is during stack create and update.

Some users have been relying on their auth token to perform all heat
operations (as all other openstack services support) however this has
led them to experience obscure errors when wait handles or alarms are
triggered.

Failing early with a clear error message will stop this class of errors.

Fixes bug: #1194303

Change-Id: I3edef3dee843bb06760be6294b798761eba30cb8

commit_message:
Avoid crash when git commit title cannot be found

Avoids a crash when there is no git commit title,
because e.g. called outside a git checkout.

Change-Id: Icf8e943a75b59adff51028dd2973ed34d80a4e69

commit_message:
Try to fix Back button in Create Services window.

Move set_wizard_goto_step() to the place where it is actually taken into resulting html.
Unfortunately it crashes after sequence Back, Next.

Fixes: bug MRN-24
Change-Id: If93d264b29ef83e821715f6224354cd2c2ab86d2

commit_message:
libvirt fix resize/migrates with swap or ephemeral

Fixes bug 1191608

The code was not properly guarding against backing files not
existing with QCOW2 images. As such, get_disk_backing_file() would
return None, then the subsequent call to basename() on None would
cause an exception.

This bug was introduced with the fix for bug 1185588 and commit
6e768363.

Change-Id: I4b1237ddf01b9398bfdc141180260136b36cae5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-09 11:09:54.000000000', 'message': 'Curl to redo the request (Found 302)

The URL to download the Fedora 19 images is not persistent anymore,
they are now download from http://download.fedoraproject.org where the
request will be redirected to a different location. Passing the -L option
to the curl command will make it redo the request on the new place and
download the image correctly.

Related to bug #1199237

Change-Id: Ib9b9d65734992e2bf1a6888c5f2eb9de366f8204
'}]
commit_message:
Curl to redo the request (Found 302)

The URL to download the Fedora 19 images is not persistent anymore,
they are now download from http://download.fedoraproject.org where the
request will be redirected to a different location. Passing the -L option
to the curl command will make it redo the request on the new place and
download the image correctly.

Related to bug #1199237

Change-Id: Ib9b9d65734992e2bf1a6888c5f2eb9de366f8204

commit_message:
Add support for new release radar tracking

Ignore Low and Undefined blueprints in the active blueprints list,
unless they are already Implemented.
Adjust colors for Essential/High/Medium/Low accordingly.
Fix alignment of past milestones table.

Change-Id: I33c0058b6f827d67340cc8f6077bfa81f07782a2
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/36202
Approved: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Reviewed-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Preserve network order when using ConfigDrive

Pass network_info to be used by InstanceMetadata instead of fetching
it by API and losing originally requested network order. This is
similar to what has been done for "content" where the original data
is lost after the initial call.

This issue only affects the ConfigDrive code path as the original
network_info is used when using file injection.

HyperV and XenApi are still probably affected by the bug but
unaffected by this fix. The fix is the same for these drivers. Simply
pass a network_info and it will be used instead of fetching the
network info by API.

Change-Id: Ie673b725cb47bf491009db99f6cb1258d46b0a69
Fixes: bug #1156844

commit_message:
Use the same logger class in all test cases

tempest.common.log is used by the most test cases,
but not all of them using it.

This change is aims to fix this anomaly.

Change-Id: I45e667fc4a9938605d131585315659930bfedfce

commit_message:
Port extended-availability-zone API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I531a2d2f68a268d44eaef3a5af0a9c799787b188

> I think you meant "tests should be a package."
No, I mean it should be a Python module

> But besides, we just moved from nose to testr, and I've never seen any issues with nose and the fact that this directory was not a python package. Can you be more specific with the benefit here / file a bug?

if I run "nosetests tests.test_foo", it won't work if tests isn't an importable module. Even though we may have moved to testr, I find it really inconvenient. For example, I don't know how to stop a test run with testr at the first failing test, how to jump into pdb right away or how to run only one tests. AFAICS, testr can't do that, right?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-23 02:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://paste.openstack.org/raw/29741/'}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-23 13:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is what I meant:

http://paste.openstack.org/raw/29749/

I agree, one can invoke it like you did, what happens behind the scenes is that nose searches the directory tree for a python file named test_auth.py and threats this as a top-level module. I got my error because I invoke the test as a sub-module. Being able to do this makes sense, consider this example (from glance actually):

$ nosetests glance.tests.functional

The intent is to run all functional tests, this only works because glance and glance.tests are modules.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-01-23 13:20:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I agree. The 'tests' directory should be a python package. It makes running individual tests easier with nose and allows importing specific modules/test cases.

Is there any drawback to doing this?"}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-23 13:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-01-23 13:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dolph gave the reasoning, but I can improve the commit message, sure. Besides the consisteny thing, the tests sub-package usually isn't installed by distros. With my openSUSE hat on I can say that we split these of into special test RPM packages.

Also, we already have keystone/tests.py which invokes the testsuite, so I don't think it makes sense to keep the tests on the rootdir but the runner inside the keystone package."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-28 18:03:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I was asked to elaborate on my opinion of not liking this, which is sad for me because I am used to operating by fiat.

I read through the longish conversation above and see no pertinent reason to move the tests. I did notice recently that nose was giving errors because there was no tests/__init__.py, that appears resolved by this: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23143/ 

Reasons for having tests in a separate directory:
1. They are not part of the distribution, why put them in the directory just to strip them out again in the package.
2. Tests frequently have a bunch of additional non-python data, fixtures and weird helper scripts, I tend to want those pretty separate from the actual library's code and my opinions are usually pretty good.
3. I work on tests a lot, they generally take longer to write than the code they are testing, I write helper scripts for them, I dump results from them, I test out alternate versions of tests a bunch: having the tests folder at the top level just saves a bunch of typing, it lets me live in the root directory without having to prefix most of my paths with keystone/tests/.
4. Tests are first-class citizens, they are just about as important as the other code and when I look at an open source project I want to see a tests directory immediately otherwise I start getting nervous.
5. "Nova and Glance do it" is not frequently a valid reason for doing something, many of the decisions taken in those (and any project) were arrived at by chance or the opinions of a single person (who was not me).
6. Why change something that is working fine?'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-03-01 04:08:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

it would have been swell if the formatting on that hadn't been blown away :/"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-08 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Restored

Sorry for not replying earlier, I'll try to 'inline' comment even with broken formatting ;-)

> I read through the longish conversation above and see no pertinent reason to move the tests. I did notice recently that nose was giving errors because there was no tests/__init__.py, that appears resolved by this: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23143/

That was the initial motivation, see Patchset 1. However, this turned out into a "why don't you ..." which slightly went off-track ;-) However, I'll address that later on.

> Reasons for having tests in a separate directory: 

> 1. They are not part of the distribution, why put them in the directory just to strip them out again in the package. 

Well, previously you already had "keystone/test.py", so tests weren't entirely separate. Also, I'm actually part
of openSUSE's OpenStack packagers and yes, we do have our issues with distributing tests (and I assume you're not referring to setuptools distributions but distro's). But moving directories between (RPM) packages is easy as pie. More difficult is is stuff like how setuptools_git is (ab)used, but that's a different story.

> 2. Tests frequently have a bunch of additional non-python data, fixtures and weird helper scripts, I tend to want those pretty separate from the actual library's code 

That's a worthy reason in general, but it doesn't seem to be the case here?

> and my opinions are usually pretty good. 

After reading this half-sentence I'm almost inclined to not continue reading, but I'll try to answer to your
complaints anyway.

> 3. I work on tests a lot, they generally take longer to write than the code they are testing, I write helper scripts for them, I dump results from them, I test out alternate versions of tests a bunch: having the tests folder at the top level just saves a bunch of typing, it lets me live in the root directory without having to prefix most of my paths with keystone/tests/. 
> 4. Tests are first-class citizens, they are just about as important as the other code and when I look at an open source project I want to see a tests directory immediately otherwise I start getting nervous. 

I tend to value "we" more than "I", thus I can't really comment on my personal habbits. That doesn't mean I'm against these concerns, but the way they are formulated is much more like personal taste, i.e. not necessarily
best practices for the project as a whole. 

> 5. "Nova and Glance do it" is not frequently a valid reason for doing something, many of the decisions taken in those (and any project) were arrived at by chance or the opinions of a single person (who was not me).

I don't think this is fair criticism and even though you may even have a point, I still believe that unification where possible across OpenStack components has merrit. Whether it is the way this review (and the other reviewers) suggests or something different is maybe better discussed on the ML.

> 6. Why change something that is working fine?

Again, it wasn't for me initially. Since Patchset 1, the review evolved quite a bit due to core reviewer recommendations. That's where it is now and I tend to like it. With my packager hat on it even has the advantage
that I can re-use the same RPM macros for packaging keystone tests that what we do for other components already.


So maybe it's best if a 3rd-party could help coming to a conclusion here.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-04-09 13:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-04-09 14:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I am in favor of this, for a couple of reasons that do not have anything to do with project alignment. However, project alignment is also important and something that we've consistently made decisions in favor of project wide.

First and foremost, having:

tests/__init__.py

In the top level implies that you have a top-level python package called "tests". I'm pretty sure that this is not, in fact, what that directory is. Rather, it is a collection of tests _for_ keystone - which means that keystone.tests is a more apt description of it.

Secondly, I believe that we should install the code for the tests when we install the code. It's python, which means it's not a lot of code/doesn't matter from a code-size perspective. For folks doing packaging, such as debian, it's easy for them to remove this code and put it into an additional package. For folks consuming keystone or building things on top of keystone, it can be really useful to re-use core keystone tests to ensure that their code didn't break something. If there are data file fixtures, we should really be: a) including them in package_data b) accessing those data files through pkg_resources and c) doing that accessing via a proper fixtures library fixture. That way we can do exciting things like install our code and then run tests on the installed version... which lets us know if we're actually providing a thing that works.

As soon as we complete the move to testr for keystone, the "it's more work to type a longer path" issue should go away, since testr supports bounded regexes for test selection.

In short, other than style questions, putting the tests in keystone doesn't hurt anyone and may help someone. Doing it the other way doesn't provide extra functionality to anyone. Also, toplevel namespace pollution is just rude.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-17 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-17 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

commit_message:
Add image id to the logging message for upload

Adding image id so the log message can be more explicit as to
which image it is refering to for upload exception.

Change-Id: I5615366b1a9b9e8a40592626d05a5608fca6c3c2

(1 inline comment)

Thanks for the clarifications.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Hi Phil,

I get a 409 error from Keystone when trying to create tenants with the same name as other existing tenants.

How can I create two tenants with the same name?
Also, is this a bug that should be filed against all openstack project?

+1 comment inline concerning argparse."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Salvatore,

The Keystone v3 API introduces the concept of a domain above tenant, and within a domain you can have tenants with the same name. 

I raised the same bug on the Nova client (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34809) - Cinder and Glance already have support for tenant_id

Phil'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi,

Maybe I should have made this clearer in the commit message, but I have already answered this in the above comments:

The Keystone v3 API introduces the concept of a domain above tenant, and within a domain you can have tenants with the same name.

I raised the same bug on the Nova client (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34809) - Cinder and Glance already have support for tenant_id

(Even without that, allowing users to use tenant_id instead of tenant_name when this is supported by the keystone API seems a useful addition doesn't it  ?)"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure - I think it might work if the name is unique across domains but fail with an error if not.   

Once we have all the upstream clients supporting tenant_id we'll be advising our customers to start using that instead of names, but we'd want both supported for a while to manage the transition.

Either way we'd presumably want to still allow tenant_name as an option for people using the client with v2 based systems"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Allow tenant ID for authentication

Under the Keystone v3 API Tenant names are not necessarily uniques
across Domains for a User, so the client should also allow
authentication by tenant_id

Fixes bug 1196486

Change-Id: I3f385a19c1d3d66f5539f901796bbaa22d315762

In general we probably do want to log these types of errors... but
not as ERRORS. I think log Warning messages are probably more
appropriate here since it would be possible to hit this when
expired certs are refreshed...

Fixes LP Bug #1190230.

Change-Id: I0383f7e490ddcdfb31a62cd3760102152a8d16d9
'}]
commit_message:
Log cms_verify issues as warnings (not errors).

In general we probably do want to log these types of errors... but
not as ERRORS. I think log Warning messages are probably more
appropriate here since it would be possible to hit this when
expired certs are refreshed...

Fixes LP Bug #1190230.

Change-Id: I0383f7e490ddcdfb31a62cd3760102152a8d16d9

commit_message:
Divide dhcp and l3 agent scheduling into separate extensions

Rationale behind this is that some plugins may support only dhcp or l3 agent scheduling.
The patch is nothing more than refactoring. Functionality was not changed.

Fixes bug 1196806

Change-Id: Ie174059adfaed3028bbf65de7bde3497dd9bc664

[{'created': '2013-06-29 06:10:23.000000000', 'message': "Use one action both for vnc and spice console in remote-consoles API v3

* To remove redundant actions merging 'get_vnc_console' and
'get_spice_console' into one action 'get_remote_console'.
* Catch 'exception.ConsoleTypeInvalid' explicitly.
* Add decorator 'extensions.expected_errors'.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I47cf83aff6e4c4dd998a310749a7b921caf89612
"}]
commit_message:
Use one action both for vnc and spice console in remote-consoles API v3

* To remove redundant actions merging 'get_vnc_console' and
'get_spice_console' into one action 'get_remote_console'.
* Catch 'exception.ConsoleTypeInvalid' explicitly.
* Add decorator 'extensions.expected_errors'.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I47cf83aff6e4c4dd998a310749a7b921caf89612

- http://logs.openstack.org/33550/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/11537 : FAILURE in 37m 42s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-06-24 20:43:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thank you for highlighting this issue with working code.

I would prefer that we solve this in a less nova specific way.  We should re-visit the externally exposed states of a glance image and their transitions.  A user should certainly be able to transition from a new state to an error state (and associating error information seems perfectly reasonable as well).  However I think this should be designed in and not worked around."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-06-26 21:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

John I tend to agree with you, do you want to work that other approach in a blueprint, I can help with implementation and blueprint design.'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-06-26 21:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Would something like this work? Allow image state to be updated to error state only if currently in queue state. This update request will also bring an error property that could be added to the image for inspection later.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-29 16:02:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm starting to feel like a bit of a broken record.

I don't think it makes sense for glance to track nova's snapshot task flow. If a nova snapshot action fails, it is nova's responsibility to report that fact and to try to clean up resources.

A snapshot is not an asynchronous action for glance. Its just a regular upload. We report the success and failure of regular uploads through the http response. If you fail an upload, we should *not* be setting the image to killed.

Having glance behave differently based on an image property seems a bit nasty."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-01 14:23:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for comments Mark, I see you feel strong about this, and I understand the reasons. I do have a few question that will let me understand a bit better, lets forget about nova for a moment and just look at a normal client/server flow where more than one client are looking at the image. When a client A creates and image and those not provide image to upload nor location, the image is put in queue state, which looks like it means I'm waiting for the image data. Mean time client B starts tracking states of the image in question. I client A can't not provide the image nor location because of whatever error, how does client B know something is wrong vs still waiting for image to be uploaded? I think we need a way to tell client B that this image is not waiting for upload anymore, but it is not usable (kill, error... some state that indicate something is not right will be useful, considering image is bad on timeouts could work but could be an issue if images are big and things do take time as a matter of normal business. 

I do realize this patch is nova specific but I was just trying to show a real scenario that happens all the time vs just theory with above usecase. I agree that using props to change state is ungly I think we should update state to change state, but I need to get green light from more experience folks on this."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-09 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-09 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

Fixes bug 1191115

Patch will check for nova error property and set image to
killed if the current status is queued. This will allow
to differentiate between long running snapshots and error
conditions that can be reported right away via PUT request

Change-Id: Ibb0968f40cc99f0177dc6909ae08767442030472
'}, {'created': '2013-06-19 19:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Allows nova snapshot errors to be passed to glance

killed if the current status is queued. This will allow
to differentiate between long running snapshots and error
conditions that can be reported right away via PUT request

Change-Id: Ibb0968f40cc99f0177dc6909ae08767442030472
'}]
commit_message:
Allows nova snapshot errors to be passed to glance

Fixes bug 1191115

Patch will check for nova error property and set image to
killed if the current status is queued. This will allow
to differentiate between long running snapshots and error
conditions that can be reported right away via PUT request

Change-Id: Ibb0968f40cc99f0177dc6909ae08767442030472

[{'created': '2013-06-12 18:19:33.000000000', 'message': 'Rule based access control improvements - attempt 2

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.  This does not impact the current default policy
checking behavior.

Change-Id: I0f2ea9878e8903390159567cf9409d86256a94e8

commit_message:
Rule based access control improvements - attempt 2

This change implements a number of proposed improvements
to the current rule based access control in Nova.  Changes
have been made to remove the require_admin_context decorator
in places where it overrides the rule defined in policy.json.
Changes have been made to allow command access to be defined
for individual commands in cases where a single rule currently
applies to multiple commands.  Error handling has been
improved to always return an HTTP 403 in cases where a rule
check fails.  This does not impact the current default policy
checking behavior.

Change-Id: I0f2ea9878e8903390159567cf9409d86256a94e8
Implements: blueprint rbac-improvements

For which purpose do you want to add this feature?'}, {'account_id': 6831, 'date': '2013-05-24 13:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Reply to Sergey Lukjanov:

Our management app needs to perform periodic maintenance and diagnostics on all data nodes.  This patch allows a supervisor application to manage this type of interaction with the nodes at a higher level; as long as we have access to at least one node in the cluster we can manage all nodes within the cluster without needing initmate knowledge of the complete architecture.  This relieves the supervisor from the task of coordinating architecture changes as drives, nodes, etc. are added/removed.

If you need more details please ping me ...'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-05-27 20:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Added ability to extract all in-use nodes from the 'endpoints' target.
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Changed the 'endpoints' target so it returns data from all rings and
added 'service' filter.
Added a 'raw' filter that provides more detail.

Added 'service' filter which allows the user to specify which service(s)
they are interested in.

Example:

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6011/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6012/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6021/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6022/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",

		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6041/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6042/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object
			Returns:

		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/"]

commit_message:
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Added ability to extract all in-use nodes from the 'endpoints' target.
Changed '/endpoints' to return info from all rings, cleanup

Changed the 'endpoints' target so it returns data from all rings and
added 'service' filter.
Added a 'raw' filter that provides more detail.

Added 'service' filter which allows the user to specify which service(s)
they are interested in.

Example:

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6011/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6012/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6021/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6022/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6031/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6032/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6041/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6042/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object
			Returns:
		["http://127.0.0.1:6010/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6020/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6030/",
		"http://127.0.0.1:6040/"]

	curl -i http://10.254.11.1:6010/endpoints?service=object\&raw
			Returns:
		[{"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6010,
		  "zone": 1},
		  {"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6020,
		  "zone": 2},
		  {"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6030,
		  "zone": 3},
		  {"ip": "127.0.0.1",
		  "region": 1,
		  "service": "object",
		  "port": 6040,
		  "zone": 4}]

Change-Id: Iab73ad9168a399061b964ad4bbbc7bd62d92e8de

Minor changes per review comments

Change-Id: Iab73ad9168a399061b964ad4bbbc7bd62d92e8de

Fixes bug: 1075336

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to

commit_message:
Sync install_venv_common from oslo

The current version of install_venv_common uses the --distribute flag
in its creation of the virtualenv. This causes some upgrade problems
with the new versions of distribute and setuptools. The solution to
those problems is to get off of the distribute bandwagon.

Change-Id: I5efe196c46b12d88c853f8362ebcbf0cc6f1573d

commit_message:
Context helper improved, avoid 500 instead of 404

* context.has_ctx() helper has been added
* has context check added to teardown to avoid 500 instead of 404

Fixes bug: #1198099

Change-Id: I198e73637fe4b973d2d99873d66cf5ddd49a43e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 15:54:22.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e
'}, {'created': '2013-06-26 19:45:47.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Config Drive Support

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Config Drive Support

Previously, nova did not support forcing config_drive
and users would need to specify the config-drive=true
nova CLI option.  However, Horizon G release is unable
spawn instances using the config-drive=true CLI option.
This change provides the ability for users to fully leverage
config_drive for Nova deployments.

More information on Config Drive can be found here:
  http://http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/config-drive.html

The change implements a new force_config_drive parameter.
The parameter is set to false to maintain backwards compatability.

Change-Id: Ic2fc7c74134a041cba35b6fcd19b0716f7dc7a0e

changes.

[{'created': '2013-06-28 14:33:46.000000000', 'message': "Set the correct URLs in the version return data

The URLs advertised in the data returned by keystone's '/' route default
to localhost and is not usable from off-host.  Not that anything in
DevStack uses it (yet).

Change-Id: I049789f568eff48c1abb0678c3ac0ae8a8960c64
"}]
commit_message:
Set the correct URLs in the version return data

The URLs advertised in the data returned by keystone's '/' route default
to localhost and is not usable from off-host.  Not that anything in
DevStack uses it (yet).

Change-Id: I049789f568eff48c1abb0678c3ac0ae8a8960c64

[{'created': '2013-06-28 14:02:30.000000000', 'message': "Enable configuration of Identity API v3

* Default IDENTITY_API_VERSION to '2.0' in stackrc

Note: the value of these *_API_VERSION variables will NOT include
the leading 'v' as the CLI tools do not allow it.

Change-Id: Ic6473833be35625282e7442f3c88fc1c4d0cc134
"}]
commit_message:
Enable configuration of Identity API v3

* Default IDENTITY_API_VERSION to '2.0' in stackrc

Note: the value of these *_API_VERSION variables will NOT include
the leading 'v' as the CLI tools do not allow it.

Change-Id: Ic6473833be35625282e7442f3c88fc1c4d0cc134

requirements/update.py run.

commit_message:
Add tests for server actions

1. Add tests to test pause, unpause, suspend & resume server actions
2. Add xml services for pause, unpause, suspend & resume server actions

Partially implements blueprint add-missing-server-actions-tests

Change-Id: I3f425c02b5c7f4e917afd15638a060226b2af8ad

commit_message:
xenapi: cleanup VM Installation

VM installation created a machine with multiple network interfaces. This
is a needless complexity at that point, we only need one interface. This
change removes the complex network interface setup from
install-os-vpx.sh script, so that only one network interface is created,
which is connected to the selected network (management by default). This
change also removes a lot of non-used code from install-os-vpx.sh
Specify the network to be used for ubuntu netinstall with:

    UBUNTU_INST_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME

defaults to $MGT_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME.

This change also includes:
 - use precise as default

Related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ib0a0a316e849f2c2651305ea657c84820cd2bb3b

And you gave an excellent response to that, would just be nice to know this can't be regressed in the future if we have a backing test."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-06-28 15:45:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks like the existing behavior is just flat-out broken.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-06-28 15:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

After talking it over in IRC, it looks like this just takes care of itself so a backing test won't prove anything:

(10:42:28 AM) dscannell: I don't think python allows kwargs to have an entry indexed by a positional argument name
(10:44:06 AM) dscannell: if you passed into the function something like get_instance_nw_info(…, host="myhost") instead of it being placed into the kwargs, the positional 'host' parameter gets the value "myhost"'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-06-28 16:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-06-29 07:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If I understand correctly then the only place that the host is used is on line 324 (in _get_dhcp_ip). Until no the function used the value self.host as None was passed. 
I wonder if this may be a problem?'}, {'account_id': 1636, 'date': '2013-07-01 18:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

garyk: This is a problem because there are iptables rules defined to allow DHCP traffic between the instance and the DHCP host. In the multi-host setup the DHCP host is the same as the instance, and in this case the host is passed in. Since this issue was introduced in Grizzly, I have found that the DHCP host filter in the iptables rules seems random and this is because it is no longer based on the instance's host, but rather based on whichever nova-network responded to the get_instance_nw_info(...) call.

For reference this is the change set that introduced the issue: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/65dbf21c91729fa20fed95e1cf69cda6421e9a45"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-03 18:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Avoid redefining host to none in get_instance_nw_info(...)

The host parameter is required and a part of the method signature.
When it is redefined from kwargs.get('host') the supplied value
gets redefined to None. This removes the redefinition and keeps the
parameter value intact.

Fixes bug #1194178

Change-Id: I779cbce909935a4b794c16cefb0128f16f8563fb

commit_message:
Work without admin_token_auth middleware

Requests would fail with a 500 Internal Server Error if the
admin_token_auth middleware was removed from the paste pipeline.
The requests would fail because the code assumed that the context
contained an 'is_admin' element, but that element was only in
the context if the admin_token_auth middleware was in the
pipeline.

This change makes it so that if the admin_token_auth middleware
isn't in the paste pipeline requests will not fail with a
500 Internal Server Error.

Change-Id: Ic064785226ee70ee475d8f72fea3c2ae6971a07f
Fixes: bug 1190708

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin
tenant cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I1e9a541ac46cd50faeb8f59196b6e17e202135c1
'}]
commit_message:
Orchestration tests to use admin user, demo tenant.

Heat tests have unique credentials requirements, so the identity admin
tenant cannot be used.

These requirements are:
- (username=admin) must be an admin user with authority to create
  other users
- (tenant_name=demo) tenant must have a private quantum network
  with dhcp enabled

Change-Id: I1e9a541ac46cd50faeb8f59196b6e17e202135c1

commit_message:
Added logic to skip migrations for sqlite databases, as sqlite does not support altering
schema data.

Added non-py Alembic files to packaging process, as they must be present for
migration sprocessing to success in deployed environments.

Modified the version stamping script to stamp versions without need for templated fields to
be preserved, allowing for repeated calls to update scripts automatically. This is
especially useful for development purposes.

Change-Id: I98af79fee8fec3ac131e54035d00ce0a8f855a63

commit_message:
Remove property features from quantum_network

In a previously merged commit: 36144 , the feature implementation
of the quantum_network provider was removed b/c it was determined
to be faulty.

This commit removes the usage of features from the type, so that
properties that depend on those features can still be used.

Change-Id: I32e36d8c1b803dda1dcea5f6ee47a64d1d09d3b8

[{'created': '2013-07-08 23:38:05.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extension checks for quantum_network.

 * The extension checks were failing if /etc/quantum/quantum.conf
   did not yet exist, which could easily be the case if quantum
   installation was attempted during the same run as provisioning.
   Since the checks are pointless anyway - the provider and l3
   extensions are essential parts of the quantum api - this change
   removes them.

Change-Id: I872d56b29ee4de8fefcd1e8ee0c0666cacccb533
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extension checks for quantum_network.

 * The extension checks were failing if /etc/quantum/quantum.conf
   did not yet exist, which could easily be the case if quantum
   installation was attempted during the same run as provisioning.
   Since the checks are pointless anyway - the provider and l3
   extensions are essential parts of the quantum api - this change
   removes them.

Change-Id: I872d56b29ee4de8fefcd1e8ee0c0666cacccb533

commit_message:
Sync requirements with openstack/requirements

Don't require higher/different versions than
openstack/requirements. It seems those higher
requirements are not needed after all (I wasn't
able to figure out why it was added)

Change-Id: I4ea313212c0ead30e88669051f541d179eb2ecf0

commit_message:
Start using pyflakes

Instead of globally disabling pyflakes warnings,
disable only those that occur frequently and
fix the rest. Enable gating on those.

Change-Id: I774d809ebcda2339b30c104b031211a3b2c491bd

commit_message:
Requirements: Remove factory_boy, allow SQLAlchemy 0.7.10

SQLAlchemy 0.7.10 is compatible with SQLAlchemy 0.7.x, so
allow it. Also remove dependency on factory_boy, which
seems to be unused.

Change-Id: Idb6bdf6ba02f2d826e2d11a9e2324f7d0a236a57

commit_message:
Add callbacks for set_global_engine

This adds functionality where a class can monitor for the global
engine changing.

This is useful for a class that caches the global engine and
wants to know when its cached global engine isn't valid anymore.

Part of fix for bug 1179259

Change-Id: I5736a05308c63de9fccb8af7720ddd70530f4270

update Quantum to Neutron

Update to use the neutronclient library and replaces Quantum references within
the repository.

implements bug: 1197208

[{'created': '2013-07-02 17:28:35.000000000', 'message': 'Set the scenario/img_dir option for tempest.conf

The default value does not work unless devstack is installed in
/opt/stack/new/devstack. This patch changes the img_dir option to point
to the correct install location.

Change-Id: Iea41d209dad10b2f9a7c97efd55c39a8d29347cc
'}]
commit_message:
Set the scenario/img_dir option for tempest.conf

The default value does not work unless devstack is installed in
/opt/stack/new/devstack. This patch changes the img_dir option to point
to the correct install location.

Change-Id: Iea41d209dad10b2f9a7c97efd55c39a8d29347cc

[{'created': '2013-07-02 22:00:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to run stress tests.

This commit adds a new environmental variable to enable running the
tempest stress tests. If DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_STRESS is set to 1
then the stress tests will be run.

Change-Id: I93a99e587eeb5b6624256696c0109293f835b474

commit_message:
Add option to run stress tests.

This commit adds a new environmental variable to enable running the
tempest stress tests. If DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_STRESS is set to 1
then the stress tests will be run.

Change-Id: I93a99e587eeb5b6624256696c0109293f835b474

[{'created': '2013-07-08 22:23:33.000000000', 'message': 'Updates python-quantumclient dependency to 2.2.2.

Version 2.2.2 of the quantum client is the first to include get_auth_info on
the Client object.

Change-Id: I6c6ae78e4bb7cbe85fe084d75078fd2763892de6
Fixes: Bug #1199174
'}]
commit_message:
Updates python-quantumclient dependency to 2.2.2.

Version 2.2.2 of the quantum client is the first to include get_auth_info on
the Client object.

Change-Id: I6c6ae78e4bb7cbe85fe084d75078fd2763892de6
Fixes: Bug #1199174

commit_message:
Add no locals() for string formatting test

Using locals() for formatting strings is not as clear as explicit
dictionaries and can produce hidden errors during refactoring. locals() are
already being partially removed in nova and cinder. Related to
bug 1171936

Change-Id: I6ef790ebf50d640af62c535952c7a98053869e43

commit_message:
Use oslo.sphinx and remove local copy of doc theme

Use the new oslo.sphinx version of the OpenStack doc
theme instead of copying it into this repo.

blueprint oslo.sphinx

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: I0bd91f7bb43f97b99051fed65b75fc05d5149cc8

commit_message:
Note '-V 2' is necessary for auth 2.0

Here are some questions in Launchpad, just because they miss '-V 2' for
auth 2.0.
https://answers.launchpad.net/swift/+question/231938
https://answers.launchpad.net/swift/+question/231279
So I add somethins for noteing people add the '-V 2'

Change-Id: I2e0fef969be4eca316975de03fdbc516a1069acf

subject: Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot
messages: [{'account_id': 7840, 'date': '2013-07-08 21:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nWrong patch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-08 21:39:19.000000000', 'message': "Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot

bug 1175211

Using quantum dhcp agent the VM hostname does not
match the DNS name. Quantum writes dnsmasq config
file using the instances ip address with (dots
replaced with dashes) and the dhcp_domain name.
This causes issues on the instance (instance can't
look up it's own hostname).

Changing network/quantumv2/api.py to pass instance
name as port name to quantum port create.
This will provide quantum the ability to lookup
the port name that was set and write the dnsmasq
config file using the port name.

The relevant change in quantum will be in a future
commit.

Change-Id: Ie446ce6e54434b6f49234dd41d83dce3deeb8632
"}]
commit_message:
Pass instance name to quantum port create on boot

bug 1175211

Using quantum dhcp agent the VM hostname does not
match the DNS name. Quantum writes dnsmasq config
file using the instances ip address with (dots
replaced with dashes) and the dhcp_domain name.
This causes issues on the instance (instance can't
look up it's own hostname).

Changing network/quantumv2/api.py to pass instance
name as port name to quantum port create.
This will provide quantum the ability to lookup
the port name that was set and write the dnsmasq
config file using the port name.

The relevant change in quantum will be in a future
commit.

Change-Id: Ie446ce6e54434b6f49234dd41d83dce3deeb8632

commit_message:
Use oslo.sphinx and remove local copy of doc theme

Use the new oslo.sphinx version of the OpenStack doc
theme instead of copying it into this repo.

blueprint oslo.sphinx

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: I0bd91f7bb43f97b99051fed65b75fc05d5149cc8

commit_message:
port Instance_usage_audit_log API into v3 part2

This port Instance_usage_audit_log api into v3.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Ia76b00e167c8d4514799e825e48031e45e290ed4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-17 09:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'port Instance_usage_audit_log  API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Change-Id: I671ee9b3a0061195e9f387d60a63f74acb36bbfa

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Change-Id: I671ee9b3a0061195e9f387d60a63f74acb36bbfa
'}]
commit_message:
port Instance_usage_audit_log  API into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. The copy as-is will not be loaded by either
the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The second changeset will then
make the changes required for it to work as a v3 extension.

This is being tried in order to make reviewing of extension
porting easier as gerrit will display only what is actually
changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Change-Id: I671ee9b3a0061195e9f387d60a63f74acb36bbfa

commit_message:
Notification support for host aggregate related operation

Add notification for the following operations related to host
aggregation:
1) Send notification when create a new host aggregation
2) Send notification when delete a host aggregation
3) Send notification when add host to a host aggregation
4) Send notification when delete host from host aggregation
5) Send notification when update host aggregation for aggregate
name and available zone
6) Send notification when update host aggregation meta data

Change-Id: I2dc42addb587c4765b41e464697f35b1f844fde9
Implements: blueprint notification-host-aggregate

commit_message:
Fix issue with v3 tokens and group membership roles

The driver calls used by v3 token controllers to obtain roles
for a user on both project and domain were incorrectly implemented,
leading to roles being missed out of the token. v2 tokens are not
affected, since they don't use the same driver calls.

This fixes these functions and adds additonal tests to cover the
cases (all of which would fail without this patch).  As part of this
fix, the implementation of "get_roles_for_user_and_project() is
pulled up into the driver class (like the domain equivalent is already),
since, for all implementations, it is independant of backend technology.

Fixes bug 1197874

Change-Id: I59b6882d93bdc8372be03fed0b390b002a6d0320

'}, {'account_id': 2976, 'date': '2013-07-03 20:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-07-04 04:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Perhaps I'm missing something, but it looks to me that when tenant isolation is false that it attempts to create a server based on credentials in tempest.conf that do not have admin credentials."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-07-04 13:53:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Chris, yeah, but in this case it's getting setup from ServersAdminTestJSON which uses the compute-admin credentials in tempest.conf so if allow_tenant_isolation=false then the base class uses those admin credentials to create the servers, which means the servers are created under the admin tenant, which makes the test fail because the point of the test is that the admin listing servers by default doesn't show anything - because it assumes the servers are created under the non-admin credentials.  The bug report has more information."}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-07-05 06:11:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure if we're looking at slightly different code, but it seems to me that it always uses the non admin creds even with allow_tenant_isolation=false.

I did test locally against my fairly recent devstack and the test passes with allow_tenant_isolation=false. I even put a print in the base class to check that it was taking the right path for non tenant isolation on server creation."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-07-08 20:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

The problem was pointed out in the bug, my non-admin users in tempest.conf were using the same tenant as my admin user, so that's what broke the test.  I changed to use different tenants for all 3 users and then the test passed with allow_tenant_isolation=false.

Chris - thanks for taking the time to look at this."}]

commit_message:
Skip test_list_servers_by_admin if allow_tenant_isolation=false

test_list_servers_by_admin will fail if allow_tenant_isolation=false
because the base class will use the admin credentials for building the
two test servers in setUpClass and that goes against the point of the
test.

Fixes bug 1197466

Change-Id: I7c18ee8737a315f908fa10b80e9e3c365d32b8a6

containing non-UTC timezones. Previously these timezones were ignored which

Fixes: bug #1197120

commit_message:
auth_token expiration checks respect timezones

The Keystone middleware now accepts auth tokens with expiration times
containing non-UTC timezones. Previously these timezones were ignored which
resulted in valid tokens being detected as expired.

Change-Id: Icb0124cf1e943ec6d826409fbeda77a592216bfe
Fixes: bug #1197120

commit_message:
Fix os-svc-install outside of boot-stack.

os-svc-install is meant for any image, not just those installing a new
cloud, but it was only working so far because we've only been building
boot-stack images routinely.

Fix bug 1198701.

Change-Id: I4fd170333bb36b5bf9b0c33e224c43db2d4235f5

commit_message:
Stop running apt-get during os-refresh-config.

All software installation is meant to happen during image build, not
execution. Cinder was breaking this because of it's requirement for a
dkms module. We added automatic building of dkms modules for all
kernels on the image when we sorted openvswitch out.

Fixes bug 1197371.

Change-Id: I6555a66ebdab3d4d7be927a802898bf483048590

commit_message:
Move boot-stack initialisation out of first-boot.

This permits the heat data to be updated by heat-localip, run by
os-refresh-config, before the keystone registration runs within
wipe-openstack. This is needed to generate correct registrations
for the undercloud control plane.

Change-Id: If686b56a3cc5fc45bbb40c4ec56a202576fa9b69

commit_message:
Move virtual power key generation to ORC.

To boot undercloud control planes with the right keystone endpoints
registered, we need to let os-refresh-config orchestrate the initial
setup, as os-refresh-config scripts setup the cloud metadata correctly
(specifically heat-localip).

Change-Id: Iab03bf37257db93726a7324da4f3023b736623b7

commit_message:
Make virtual power ssh pubkey world readable.

On undercloud nodes we connect as heat-admin, not root, so we need a
non-root access path or we can't enable the power manager to login and
talk to libvirt.

The code was also a little messy, so tidied up the immediate context.

Change-Id: I2e2cb487cee64736ff1b5184e52b1ffd0e4620ad

commit_message:
In sql token backend flush_tokens Delete gently.

Doing one giant delete for all the rows could be a disaster for
replication on MySQL, and also might introduce gap locks that will
prevent new tokens from being created.

Fixes bug #1188378

Change-Id: I1a7e00fb50afc3e3b3f2e10586453f219a381406

commit_message:
Don't deallocate network if destroy time out

Fixes bug #1169057
Sames as bug 1180178, if libvirt returns time out error during destroy
an instance, we also can't deallocate the network of the instance,
otherwise the fixed ip of it may be re-used by another new instance,
and resulted in the new instance can't be accessed by the fixed ip.

Change-Id: I04dfd21bb1b7168abc71f39e836126a11dad6d8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-15 02:09:14.000000000', 'message': "Enforce sqlite-specific flow in drop_unique_constraint

The nova.db.sqlalchemy.apy.drop_unique_constraint method has a
sqlite-specific flow for dropping unique constraints because it can't
use alter table like mysql or postgresql. The code is explicitly
checking if the db engine is mysql or postgresql and then falls into a
block which assumes the backing db is sqlite. This can cause problems if
the backing db is not sqlite.

This patch simply switches the checks so that the sqlite-specific flow
is only ran if the backing db is sqlite, everything else will default to
the 'alter table' flow.

Change-Id: I23b9bf33d18df3ac36106d5800a8ecdd1a4018df
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce sqlite-specific flow in drop_unique_constraint

The nova.db.sqlalchemy.apy.drop_unique_constraint method has a
sqlite-specific flow for dropping unique constraints because it can't
use alter table like mysql or postgresql. The code is explicitly
checking if the db engine is mysql or postgresql and then falls into a
block which assumes the backing db is sqlite. This can cause problems if
the backing db is not sqlite.

This patch simply switches the checks so that the sqlite-specific flow
is only ran if the backing db is sqlite, everything else will default to
the 'alter table' flow.

Change-Id: I23b9bf33d18df3ac36106d5800a8ecdd1a4018df

Change-Id: I626862ec0140bb9462313c858348356b51b1d074
'}, {'created': '2013-07-03 20:58:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add private_key property to resource.

This is needed for the Rackspace Cloud Servers resource.  The SSH key
pair is generated during the server creation, and the public key is
placed onto the server using the Cloud Servers "personalities"
feature.  When the handle_update method connects later on to transfer
the new metadata and run cfn-userdata, it will retrieve the private
key from the database in order to authenticate.

Change-Id: I626862ec0140bb9462313c858348356b51b1d074
'}]
commit_message:
Add private_key property to resource.

This is needed for the Rackspace Cloud Servers resource.  The SSH key
pair is generated during the server creation, and the public key is
placed onto the server using the Cloud Servers "personalities"
feature.  When the handle_update method connects later on to transfer
the new metadata and run cfn-userdata, it will retrieve the private
key from the database in order to authenticate.

Change-Id: I626862ec0140bb9462313c858348356b51b1d074

commit_message:
Port scheduler hints extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the scheduler hints extensions and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework. Moves the commented out tests from
the v3 version of test_servers to the config drive extension
unittests.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: If0164e3e80927662ec3b955df4642f03b2d18853

[{'created': '2013-06-25 15:18:47.000000000', 'message': 'Baremetal ensures node is off before powering on

During spawn(), ensure that a node is really off before trying to turn
it on. This fixes bug 1178919, in which a node that had previously
gotten stuck in a power-on state (eg, in the BIOS screen) would fail to

'}]
commit_message:
Baremetal ensures node is off before powering on

During spawn(), ensure that a node is really off before trying to turn
it on. This fixes bug 1178919, in which a node that had previously
gotten stuck in a power-on state (eg, in the BIOS screen) would fail to
spawn() because the baremetal driver would send a power-on request, the
BMC would ignore it, and then baremetal driver would wait indefinitely
for a DHCP request.

Change-Id: Ie73e6ab488abe99c70ad3d149d702577941056d1

subject: bug 1170155 Prevents packet fragmentation over OVS GRE tunnels
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/1042/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

A Quantum core dev must approve, syntax is good for me.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:32:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There are tabs in the documentation which should be removed.

I find interesting that this issue affects only ssl connections - fragmentation should occur in any case. However, if this has to be merged in the admin guide (assuming that we want to merge it) we should provide more explanations about this workaround - such as why it's needed and when it's needed. Ideally, it should be in the 'limitations' section.

It's also worth  mentioning whether option 26 is generally accepted or not. I found out udhcp for instance ignore some options like 121, even when forced.

However, I think the right way to proceed is to triage this in quantum, and if that this is the case, provide a fix in the dhcp agent script, as this workaround should be easy to automate."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-04-24 15:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah I think that we should look at this some more.  Also it seems like an alternative approach would be to increase the MTU of the transport network.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-05-06 02:01:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Merge upload and verification of images sections

ch_images-uploading.xml and images-verifying-install.xml have duplicated
but out of sync informations. Merge details from ch_images-uploading.xml
in images-verifying-install.xml and remove the file from the book.

Also update the Image Service commands output to match the name and ID
used in the verifying section in the rest of the doc.

Change-Id: I60537f215617b7efd61af7aa87f1fa55da6f12d2

commit_message:
Sanitize passwords in _safe_log

replace the specific sanitization with a generic one that digs
deeper into msg_data and sanitize known password fields.

Fixes LP# 1171446

Change-Id: I17926cca13175507b8869b25c1d979da88ac9037

commit_message:
Add inst_type parameter

Add inst_type parameter in order to generate the bandwidth tag into
the libvirt configuration.

Change-Id: I63c1fb51ea637d461755b309c7464f4b4d49a4b2
Fixes: bug #1185030

commit_message:
Add policy checking to compute.api.get_all_instance_metadata

Retrieves all the instance metadata and the list of instances, and
then checks the policy for each metadata against the matching instance.

Fixes bug #1192715

Change-Id: I4d3bf362d88aa58a321f00465d793e63031e3da7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-08 05:03:58.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tasks access to mutable subflow.

In order to allow tasks to provide back new
and fancy subflows as the result of the task
doing something (ex. making a decision to add
a few new tasks) we need a way to give a task
a mutable flow that they alone can add new
tasks into and which the parent flow will run
automatically if anything was added.

Change-Id: I8d929f51c50655335ad15c04a2486fc77643d20b
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tasks access to mutable subflow.

In order to allow tasks to provide back new
and fancy subflows as the result of the task
doing something (ex. making a decision to add
a few new tasks) we need a way to give a task
a mutable flow that they alone can add new
tasks into and which the parent flow will run
automatically if anything was added.

Change-Id: I8d929f51c50655335ad15c04a2486fc77643d20b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 13:16:03.000000000', 'message': "Avoid ImportError when selenium is missing.

Several distribution can't ship selenium due to it's non-free license. So they
have to patch it out of test-requirements.txt. AVoid import failure and force
not running selenium tests.

Change-Id: Id7ffaa8820eefd216d2258d56736a65ddb2483c2
"}, {'created': '2013-07-04 13:49:25.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid ImportError when selenium is missing.

Fixes LP bug 1197815

Change-Id: Id7ffaa8820eefd216d2258d56736a65ddb2483c2

Also provide a warning message. Fixes LP bug 1197815

commit_message:
Changes ComputeTaskManager class to inherit base.Base

This is going to be needed for all migrations to conductor tasks
in order to get db access. We patch it separately to reduce
conflicts.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: Icd686d373472498ed77f3133f655454aa035ae43

commit_message:
Moves populate retry logic to the scheduler utils

This change moves the _post_select_populate_filter_properties
to scheduler utils. It will be needed on conductor when we move
prep_resize code from scheduler to conductor.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: Ifed70b60a3fe178bd39eec98615c0a76ceb33cc6
