commit_message:
Fix and gate on E125

E125 continuation line does not distinguish itself from next logical
line.

E125 makes code more readable, and fixing all the existing issues allows
us to gate on this, making this one less thing reviewers have to check
for.

Fix was made using https://github.com/hhatto/autopep8

Change-Id: Ie569fd74fb84d220ceb87e37b1b1f39143bba80f

Repeating my -1 because no comment was added."}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-06-11 14:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

David are you wanting there to be a comment for all get_controller_extensions/get_resources cases where it returns an empty list?

This will be the standard "template" format for v3 API extensions that do not need to either extend the controller or the resource. The abstract base class however does require an implementation to at least return an empty list. There should not be any side effects as in Patch set 2 however.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-06-11 15:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, I think there should be a comment in all cases where the interface requires doing something weird like that.  Otherwise someone will look at the weird code and change it and break the interface.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-06-13 04:21:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-06-13 05:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-13 05:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Port agent API to v3 Part 2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the agent
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I6baa379ede41a1627f69d5d1a719cf2c6d7e9d9e

commit_message:
Rename invalid domain name to be RFC compliant.

http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6761 and
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2606 define invalid domain names to
be used in contexts such as this. It's good to be compliant with RFCs.

Change-Id: Ibb7f9ee12c0c4331f8a33470def74c3a136ef6d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-07 19:51:57.000000000', 'message': "DB2 migration support

DB2 will not allow you to rename a table if it's got a
constraint on it (a unique or foreign key constraint).

This fix change the migrations so that for DB2 the unique or FK
constraints are dropped before renaming and then restoring the
unique FK constraints.

Also, for DB2, had to give a name to the unique constraints so
that they could be manipulated.

Fixes bug 1188785

Change-Id: I7cf6ab42084e43d827ed827c64025e61e72a4672

"}, {'created': '2013-06-17 19:48:14.000000000', 'message': "DB2 migration support

DB2 will not allow you to rename a table if it's got a
constraint on it (a unique or foreign key constraint).

This fix changes the migrations so that the unique or FK
constraints are dropped from tables before renaming and then
restoring the unique FK constraints. This works for DB2 and
other DBMSs that support FK constraints such as MySQL with
InnoDB and PostgreSQL.

Also, for DB2, give a name to the unique constraints so that
they can be manipulated.

Fixes bug 1188785

Change-Id: I7cf6ab42084e43d827ed827c64025e61e72a4672

commit_message:
DB2 migration support

DB2 will not allow you to rename a table if it's got a
constraint on it (a unique or foreign key constraint).

This fix changes the migrations so that the unique or FK
constraints are dropped from tables before renaming and then
restoring the unique FK constraints. This works for DB2 and
other DBMSs that support FK constraints such as MySQL with
InnoDB and PostgreSQL.

Also, for DB2, give a name to the unique constraints so that
they can be manipulated.

Fixes bug 1188785

Change-Id: I7cf6ab42084e43d827ed827c64025e61e72a4672

Add full support for the GET /role-assignment call as a first step
to making role_assignment a first class entity.

Limitations:

- The current implementation uses the standard v3 colections wrapper
  mechanism for filtering.  Given the potential numbers of role
  assignments in a large system, this may have performance and resource
  impacts.  A future improvement would pass the filters into the
  driver layer to keep the internal assignment processing to a minimum.

- The LDAP backend is not current supported

Implemenets bp get-role-assignments

commit_message:
Implement GET /role_assignment API call

Add support for the GET /role_assignment call as a first step
to making role_assignment a first class entity.

This patch also enables v3 collection filtering to match against
attributes of entities being returned in the list, using the same
dot notation (e.g. user.id) that we already support for policy file
checking against filters.

Limitations:

- The current implementation uses the standard v3 collections wrapper
  mechanism for filtering.  Given the potential numbers of role
  assignments in a large system, this may have performance and resource
  impacts.  A future improvement would pass the filters into the
  driver layer to keep the internal assignment processing to a minimum.

- The LDAP backend is not currently supported

Implements bp get-role-assignments

Change-Id: I6ff2ea780e39d7097a88214fbb3ddee1b924c30c

commit_message:
Use python module loading to run glance-manage

Executing glance-manage in a unittest context means that we need
to install glance first, which breaks packaging workflow.

Fixes bug 1196275.

Change-Id: Idf0a332c2f2ffd3eb96d3623c32cf5383a0d9887

Flake8 should ignore build folder

Fixes bug 1198329

[{'created': '2013-06-12 15:50:10.000000000', 'message': "Force consoleauth service to use local conductor.

There's no reason for the consoleauth service to have to use the remote
conductor service, so force it to always use the local API.

Fix bug 1190271.

Change-Id: Id6f50873f792ac4393dc2063f599f0418598091b
"}, {'created': '2013-07-05 19:00:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove conductor usage from consoleauth service

There's no reason for the consoleauth service to use the conductor API
since it is allowed to use the db directly.  Remove the single conductor
API call and replace it with the equivalent db call.

Change-Id: Id6f50873f792ac4393dc2063f599f0418598091b
"}, {'created': '2013-07-05 19:01:37.000000000', 'message': "Remove conductor usage from consoleauth service

There's no reason for the consoleauth service to use the conductor API
since it is allowed to use the db directly.  Remove the single conductor
API call and replace it with the equivalent db call.

Fix bug 1190271.

Change-Id: Id6f50873f792ac4393dc2063f599f0418598091b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove conductor usage from consoleauth service

There's no reason for the consoleauth service to use the conductor API
since it is allowed to use the db directly.  Remove the single conductor
API call and replace it with the equivalent db call.

Fix bug 1190271.

Change-Id: Id6f50873f792ac4393dc2063f599f0418598091b

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-21 21:02:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We were only collecting the create.end and delete.start events before because we only wanted to bill customers for the lifetime of the instance between those two events. Is there a way to query for those times if we collect the create.start and delete.end events, too?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-06-24 09:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Doug, if your read the bug linked in the commit message
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1187833

You'll understand that this view we had has a big flaw: you'll still get exists event after delete.start.

So the real way to compute the duration is to do it based on the vm_state, not simply on listening to what you think are the "right" events.

This is why I wrote the patch this one depends one that register everything (and therefore vm_state) + this one that just stop doing things we thought were smart but are not.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-01 13:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-01 14:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Register all interesting events

As stated in bug #1187833, there's no need to not record all of this events.
We need to filter events on the state anyway.

Also adding update events and documentation on how to enable them.

Change-Id: Ic5845e1a3dc5ed531114e7ccdbe17bb98cb049fb
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Unify Counter generation from notifications

This will make sure we don't lose any metadata information from
notifications into the Counter/samples we publish.

This is part of fixing bug #1187833 and bug #1187843

Change-Id: I315581907be1dcec33f43a5d5fd7b7876a7889f6

(2 inline comments)

This code looks very good! Thank you for hooking up the store to the functional tests, that way we can check on it with a small deployment from time to time.

I have a few notes inline. I'd really love for those to be addressed before this lands, because you are in the best position to make sure the sheepdog code in glance works. The rest of us reviewers are unfortunately at a disadvantage when it comes to testing these non-openstack backends. (Same is true of ceph/rbd, gridfs, etc.)"}, {'account_id': 7598, 'date': '2013-05-31 17:47:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

hi, markwash, flavio87,
The root cause for this unit test issue is eventlet v0.12.1 package which pip tool automatic loaded has a defect, it could not work well with python v2.6.
So we can pass python27 test but 2.6. I have manually fix eventlet in my development environment, then the change can pass it.

I post the detail analysis here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/39083/

So, I have confident we can merge this bp in H-2 milestone. and seems eventlet upstream has fixed this issue in master, so we can pass this when it release to PiPy.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-29 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add Sheepdog store

Sheepdog is a distributed block storage. This patch enables Sheepdog cluster
as a backend store for glance.

Test:

You can set up a simulated 3 node cluster on the local machine with
following script:

 $ sudo apt-get install liburcu-dev
 $ git clone git://github.com/collie/sheepdog.git
 $ cd sheepdog
 $ ./autogen.sh; ./configure --disable-corosync
 $ make; sudo make install
 $ for i in 0 1 2; do sheep /tmp/store$i -n -c local -z $i -p 700$i;done
 $ collie cluster format

Then change the default store in glance-api.conf as sheepdog

blueprint: add-sheepdog-support

Change-Id: I99907bbfc2e131146de9dd1a39f94a73cd2585e9

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/35619/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/8441 : SUCCESS in 2m 22s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/35619/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/7679/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35619/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/8046 : SUCCESS in 21m 08s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35619/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/8061 : SUCCESS in 14m 22s
- http://logs.openstack.org/35619/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/36463 : SUCCESS in 17m 01s
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

For many plugins, vlan_id is a primary key on the allocation table.
Relaxing the constraint will probably cause primary key violation errors, without altering the models as well.

Also, I am not sure on the approach. I think it's ultimately up to plugin mainteiners to decide if and how implement changes into network isolation logic.
The use case for vlan reuse should probably be clarified; to me it seems the idea is to re-create something similar to a flat scenario, with the only difference that eac tenant gets a distinct IP address space, and isolation is performed through security groups; it will be interesting to see how broadcast traffic is suppressed/mitigated or restricted.

I suspect this relaxation is probably more suitable on the 'FLAT' network type."}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Salvatore. For the VLAN network type, if you reserve a specific vlan for a provider net that has already been allocated to a tenant network, then the tenant network will get all the traffic from the provider net. And if you reserve the provider net first, then no tenant will get that vlan since it is marked as allocated in the pool, so then you get inconsistent network allocation behaviour depending on the order in which networks are created.

Also, the Cisco Nexus plugin can't support this."}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2013-07-07 07:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

make sense above, abandon the change'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Unable to re-use VLANs for multiple Neutron Networks

In some networks, the topology of the networks may
require sharing different layer 3 domains across the
same VLAN - perhaps in different availability zones.

To enable this use case, a configuration switch could
be added to enable re-use of the VLANs for specific
reservation. However, consistency must be maintained
for when a VLAN is auto-generated for use
(example - quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_db_v2.py
- reserve_vlan). In that case, the flag would not be
taken into account and would attempt to use an unused
vlan still.

Fixes bug 1196634

Change-Id: I535b50bfbd97442c2f79fa9d09df3fe96c5e49cb
'}, {'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Unable to re-use VLANs for multiple Neutron Networks

In some networks, the topology of the networks may
require sharing different layer 3 domains across the
same VLAN - perhaps in different availability zones.

To enable this use case, a configuration switch could
be added to enable re-use of the VLANs for specific
reservation. However, consistency must be maintained
for when a VLAN is auto-generated for use
(example - quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_db_v2.py
- reserve_vlan). In that case, the flag would not be
taken into account and would attempt to use an unused
vlan still.

Fixes bug 1196634

Change-Id: I535b50bfbd97442c2f79fa9d09df3fe96c5e49cb
'}]
commit_message:
Unable to re-use VLANs for multiple Neutron Networks

In some networks, the topology of the networks may
require sharing different layer 3 domains across the
same VLAN - perhaps in different availability zones.

To enable this use case, a configuration switch could
be added to enable re-use of the VLANs for specific
reservation. However, consistency must be maintained
for when a VLAN is auto-generated for use
(example - quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_db_v2.py
- reserve_vlan). In that case, the flag would not be
taken into account and would attempt to use an unused
vlan still.

Fixes bug 1196634

Change-Id: I535b50bfbd97442c2f79fa9d09df3fe96c5e49cb

The latest patch is a rebase.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

2 things.


1. I believe redhat is still running some stuff on Puppet 2.6.x which we have already agreed is no longer going to be supported.

2. I helped add to the overall confusion b/c we were seeing issues (resolved with: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36011/) where prefetching failed with quantum b/c it was occurring only after the quantum_config resources were applied. I thought this was a Puppet 2.7 vs. 3.x issue (which I was totally wrong about) before I did the proper research into the Puppet code. I am still a bit confused at exactly why we were seeing the issue, and hope that I can spend more time to better characterize the issue.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I tracked down the commit from puppet core that updating prefetching to be lazy.

000a2d811c740f4179a0cd4ced38e886858cf01f

This change occurred between 2.7.9 and 2.7.10.

As an FYi, I will likely reject this patch b/c it is only required on ancient version of Puppet that I do not think we have to support.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

for now, I am going to assume you were seeing this issue b/c you were testing with Puppet 2.6.x and this -1 this patch. I am still open to further discussion, and will actively be involved next week in getting tempest working."}, {'account_id': 6994, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Tested this against openstack-installer and it's working for me."}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Why was Maru having problems with 2.7 then? Which version was he testing against?'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-07-08 14:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Abandoned

I was not seeing issues myself - I was attempting to fix the issue you reported that Michael was seeing last week, as per our irc discussion. Packstack integration still needs to happen before we'll have internal CI running.  I think we are still using 2.6, but if we run into problems I'll try to make it clear that we need to update the version we're using rather than work around it."}]

commit_message:
Switch types to lazy-load instances.

 * The prefetch method was causing problems on puppet 2.7, so this
   change switches to lazy-loading instances as is already done
   by the keystone types.

Change-Id: I420a0d19aa2ba770d466112cbb1468f607c2c232

commit_message:
Make openstack.requirements installable.

Turn requirements into a dummy package that, if installed, will
install all of OpenStack's requirements.

Change-Id: Ie2670278b740173bee09608d8ef9bf892f498aa1

'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-04 20:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I have been trying to get to the bottom of this:

I tracked down the commit from puppet core that updating prefetching to be lazy.

000a2d811c740f4179a0cd4ced38e886858cf01f

This change occurred between 2.7.9 and 2.7.10.

We were seeing issues with the quantum provider that I thought were related to this (but were actually related to something else), I am still trying to track down those exact issues.

Since Ubuntu Precise uses Puppet 2.7.11, and redhat will be using something even newer? I am not sure this change is necessary.'}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-08 04:12:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am going to -1 this b/c I believe it is only required for older verisons of puppet that I do not want to support. I really only want to support >=2.7.11. I would prefer we use Puppet's standard of the @property_hash unless we absolutely need to implement our own resource cache. I am absolutely open to more discussion if this does not seem reasonable."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:55:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This change was in keeping with the fixes for keystone and glance that were motivated by you and Michael, but since it isn't deemed necessary I'll abandon."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Updated glance_image to not use prefetch.

 * The order of the prefetch call differs between puppet 2.x and
   3.x, so its preferable to lazy-load instances instead.

Change-Id: I4f0675899226f7e6ee22102d50fe60fac8cd26bf

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-06-26 01:58:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

It's not clear to me why this is needed.  Both of the filters you mention support scope in extra_specs ... so ... just use the scope?"}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-06-26 02:26:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

>> It's not clear to me why this is needed. Both of the filters you mention support scope in extra_specs ... so ... just use the scope?

For AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, it will simply skip and ignore any scoped keys. So, in order to use this filter, the key has to be non-scoped.

However, for ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, it will try to recognize and compare BOTH scoped and non-scoped key.

So, here's a conflict, with these two filters using together, one has to use non-scoped key in order to make AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter happy, while this key will be turned down by ComputeCapabilitiesFilter."}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-06-27 22:50:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Russell, would you please reconsider above explanation and redraw the -2 vote?

Currently there is no way to make these two filters working together. It's an issue need to resolve."}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I misspoke, the aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter did not support scoped keys.  I proposed a patch here to add that, which I think is a better solution to this problem, because it avoids breaking backwards compatibility.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35867/'}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-07-08 13:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

The original issue is resolved by adding scoped key support to AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35867'}]

commit_message:
Restrict ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to use scope format only

Per discussion in https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1039386, "scope
format" is adopted as a namespace in extra_spec to avoid conflict between
scheduler filters.

For filters still accept non-scope format, e.g.
ComputeCapabilitiesFilter and AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, using
together could still conflict for non-scope key format in extra_spec.

This change restrict ComputeCapabilitiesFilter to accept scope format
only.

Resolves bug 1191185
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3327dc37eead5a7415b2507769ecadf6a656d79b

commit_message:
notifier: do not rely on CONF.host

There's nothing in Oslo declaring an 'host' configuration option, so
relying on it isn't a good practice. Let's use the same default value as
intended, but make it work in any case.

Change-Id: I9c898647e68e35435d1a58f920b6e610f217e4e8
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Update pyparsing to 1.5.7

The version of cliff we are using depends on pyparsing>=1.5.7 but
python-quantumclient pulls 1.5.6 because it appears first in the
requirements processing.

The requirements change is in
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33406/

Fixes bug #1191866

Change-Id: Ib1c11b53813ff96b750f5ffe4997ad01907d32c3

After running the unit tests (eg with tox -epy27) a stale 'nosetests'

Rework the relevant test 'test_no_client_tracebacks' to be functionally

commit_message:
Fix stale process after unit tests complete

After running the unit tests (eg with tox -epy27) a stale 'nosetests'
process was always left behind.  It left TCP ports open and held references on
inodes. The latter caused a problem with some automated build systems.

Rework the relevant test 'test_no_client_tracebacks' to be functionally
the same, but clean up fully.

Fixes bug 1198685.

Change-Id: If9d3afa370dc2bd3c470b509d38c94cfb5844518

commit_message:
The 'model_update' helper has been added.

* it's now used to make cluster status changes easier
* it'll be potentially used to set cluster status + status description
  in the following way:
  context.model_update(obj, status='X', status_description='XXX')

Change-Id: I656f3f94b3dce697e060ed2ca2d4ad8f5c955794

I'm going to -2 this temporarily - I want to give it a thorough eyeball and consider the structural impact. I will get this done Monday at the latest."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-07-08 11:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So I've had a look through this and its probably fine, but its a very broad change; and there are at least a few things that are AFAICT unrelated. So - can you please just submit a bunch of single purpose changes (so we can enable this!)

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-08 11:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

This is pretty massive, I worry about the effects it might have being so broad when we could do it in phases.

My -1 is just for small issues, see in-line."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-07-08 11:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

REST API validation implementation

* All json schemas are implemented

Implements blueprint savanna-rest-api-1-0-validation

commit_message:
Prevent wrongly privilege escalation of a context

Current codes in create_volume() may exists a scenario that
a context which is not elevated but after it fails in volume
creation, it becomes elevated. This patch saves original
context, so that if it fails in volume creation simply use the
original context for further scheduling.

Fix bug:1187076

Change-Id: I2822b1612ec741209b278fc65f18d0f8f3243e0a

commit_message:
Use print operator in function style

This is compatible with Python 3.x and works
with any Python version >= 2.6.

Change-Id: I6d8afdc5135cb01e6096f4d25b4ca632fe1e75cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-22 15:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'Make get_object_by_id() work for most Django objects.

Django object id is usually an int while lookup is an unicode string.
It works for Openstack but not other Django objects.

This patch makes other standard Django apps reusing Horizon easier.

Change-Id: I436c34e8b17340537f8d201001741d34c933764e
'}]
commit_message:
Make get_object_by_id() work for most Django objects.

Django object id is usually an int while lookup is an unicode string.
It works for Openstack but not other Django objects.

This patch makes other standard Django apps reusing Horizon easier.

Change-Id: I436c34e8b17340537f8d201001741d34c933764e

commit_message:
Revert "fixes nova resize bug when force_config_drive is set."

This reverts commit 8ae97f24b0c806a438456170959ae527ce33ad01

This issue was already tracked and fixed in bug 1163598.
The user's packaged version was just lagging behind the released fix.

Change-Id: I9260ce7b00b0500b168f5a385696361b4f8e73fd

[{'created': '2013-06-20 13:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add troubleshoot to baremetal PXE template.

We recently added an optional troubleshoot parameter to
diskimage_builder which defaults to 0 (false).

This commit adds the option to the Nova pxe_config.template
so it will be easier for people to find should they need to
enable troubleshooting mode.
Change-Id: I169a5e3b7a9d80e18e389ae4645d2c5bbdae2a6f
'}]
commit_message:
Add troubleshoot to baremetal PXE template.

We recently added an optional troubleshoot parameter to
diskimage_builder which defaults to 0 (false).

This commit adds the option to the Nova pxe_config.template
so it will be easier for people to find should they need to
enable troubleshooting mode.
Change-Id: I169a5e3b7a9d80e18e389ae4645d2c5bbdae2a6f

commit_message:
Update nagios3.yaml to reflect changes to the postfix element.

Recent changes to the postfix element added new parameters so
the nagios3 template needed to updated to ensure postfix works
as expected.

Change-Id: I0a9eb8e0988470888f35adcc426ccd314f93b301
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Standardize use of nova.db

We already mostly use:
from nova import db
instead of:
import nova.db.api

So change remaining few cases to use nova.db instead of nova.db.api.
Help make code more uniform and easy to work with.

Change-Id: I6183352c4bbe77b88a5b277788f588b0b48c6476

commit_message:
Port coverage API into v3 part2

This patch contains the changes required to adapt the hypervisor
extension and the corresponding unittest to the v3 framework.

And adding '_import_coverage' for ensure loading coverage module from
python-coverage.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: I6a2dbf00d09132b767cd7972f68cb752b5961796

commit_message:
Fix parsing of resource creation output.

 * The results of resource creation were previously not being
   parsed at all, so that new instances would not have their
   property_hash properly populated.  This change ensures
   correct property_hash population.
 * Stop using an instance variable when a local variable (attrs)
   with do.

Change-Id: I88fe3ba964839762d5ad6a431d3d9ab876266fe9

commit_message:
Default to using the catalog for tenant lookup.

 * Only if the tenant cannot be found in the catalog will instances
   be used.
 * Replaced the get_tenant_id method in the providers with an inline
   call since it is only needed for create()

Change-Id: I1bb4b6d9998f9d334df10bf9b1f683c4f2f38150

[{'created': '2013-07-08 04:34:16.000000000', 'message': "Minor cleanup for the quantum_l3_ovs_bridge provider.

 * Use collect() instead of manually building an array in
   bridge_ip_addresses.
 * Update the property_hash's value for ensure when the resource
   is created or destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib62c74c7a9ba38bdd57b263eeee94f370611b8b9
"}, {'created': '2013-07-08 04:34:16.000000000', 'message': "Minor cleanup for the quantum_l3_ovs_bridge provider.

 * Use each() instead of collect() when iterating in
   bridge_ip_addresses.
 * Update the property_hash's value for ensure when the resource
   is created or destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib62c74c7a9ba38bdd57b263eeee94f370611b8b9
"}]
commit_message:
Minor cleanup for the quantum_l3_ovs_bridge provider.

 * Use each() instead of collect() when iterating in
   bridge_ip_addresses.
 * Update the property_hash's value for ensure when the resource
   is created or destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib62c74c7a9ba38bdd57b263eeee94f370611b8b9

commit_message:
Improve tenant_hash usage in keystone_tenant.

 * The tenant_hash used by the keystone_tenant type to keep track
   of tenants is now updated with new tenants as they are created.
 * Added 'instance' helper method that returns
   tenant_hash[resource[:name]]
 * Added spec tests for the changes.

Change-Id: I077e5012a3f2d20d3df4cc55f1150490d4b31f58

commit_message:
engine : add suspend/resume support to User resource

When a User resource is in suspended state, disable the keystone
user owned by the resource

blueprint stack-suspend-resume

Change-Id: Iee8dddcfbc0fc9bd132ddfadd2a17eb1b0894f51

But it does not harm to add it in watchrule.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-07-05 08:34:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Transiting to this new state is not triggered by watchrule actions (ALARM, NORMAL, NODATA). It might be better to read the suspend state from the associated CloudWatchAlarm.

I did consider this, but it would require reworking the interface so the evaluate() and create_watch_data() happens through the CloudWatchAlarm not the watchrule.  It looked simpler and less risky to just add an additional state to watchrule.WatchRule instead, and also I didn't want to pollute the CloudWatchAlarm resource with these interfaces when they are going to be removed when we move to  ceilometer anyway."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-05 10:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
engine : add suspend/resume support to watch resource

Add suspend/resume support to CloudWatchAlarm resource and
underlying watchrule - this means that when in suspended
state watches will not allow new metric data to be added
or for alarm evaluation/actions to happen

blueprint stack-suspend-resume

Change-Id: Ic9a1c1bd86ac8156f260791089a38889eabc6528

commit_message:
Port os-console-output extension to API v3 Part 1

This changeset only copies the v2 files (implementation and test)
into the appropriate v3 directories unchanged. The copy as-is
will not be loaded by either the v2 or v3 extension loaders. The
second changeset will then make the changes required for it to
work as a v3 extension.

This is being done in order to make reviewing of extension porting
easier as gerrit will display only what is actually changed for v3
rather than entirely new files

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I7e3519b2367184b34ac7e4df3edf7df38c870a02

subject: Fix to integer cast of length in console output extension

This fixes a small issue when you try to use console output length as a
float point value (as a float point itself not as string).

request, returning bad request, but now this check in completelly done in api
level (it was partially done before) instead of wait until it fails behind the
rpc call.

Also includes a small clean up in fake_policy.py:

correct one is "compute_extension:consoles".

commit_message:
Fix to integer cast of length in console output extension

This fixes a small issue when you try to use console output length as a
float point value (as a float point itself not as string).
The extension was behaving as expected due to impossibility to fulfil the
request, returning bad request, but now this check in completelly done in api
level (it was partially done before) instead of wait until it fails behind the
rpc call.

Naturally a test was added to explicit it and avoid future regression.

related to blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ifd7ce90dfd88acc8b22e7d190eafc3dd686186e9

commit_message:
Add unique constraints to Service.

Added unique constraints 'uniq_services0host0topic0deleted'
('host', 'topic', 'deleted') and 'uniq_services0host0binary0deleted'
('host', 'binary', 'deleted') to Service model and migrate sripts.
Added new exceptions `ServiceTopicExists` and `ServiceBinaryExists`.
Updated service_create(). Tests updated respectively.
Tests in test_compute updated to avoid conflicts with Service UC.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: I4d9d8cf38afc2fdca3eead65fced5001a1af209e

I do wonder if maybe raising NotFound in the sqlalchemy driver would be more correct. But I'd rather change simple db as you've done here. And the fact that this change doesn't break any unit tests. . well. . apparently we're not relying on image_tag_get_all to tell us when an image doesn't exist."}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-07-03 15:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just for the record: My logic to retrun an empty list instead of a NotFound is so we do not do two queries in image_tag_get_all and I also rather not change sqlalchemy unless we need to since it is an interface change.'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-07-03 15:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/router.py#L83

the image tags resource is accessed via an image resource, should we be indicating to the user that the image no longer exists for which they are trying to access the tag?'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-07-03 17:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It still gives a 404 if the image is not found when trying to update or delete an image tag. It would be nice if it differentiated between which resource is not found instead of always saying "An object with the specified identifier was not found." This patch doesn't change any api behavior, just makes sure db drivers are consistent.

Does this address your concern?'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-07-03 18:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

would that mean the image tags would be returned for a deleted image?'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-07-06 02:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2013-07-02 22:59:43.000000000', 'message': 'Dont raise NotFound in simple db image_tag_get_all

This patch removes the check in simple db. This is so both simple db and
sqlalchemy have the same behavior. We do not necessarily want to perform two
queries to see if the image exists so an empty list of tags is returned.

Fixes bug 1197057

Change-Id: Ibae37198b3854aa5dbe0e8a643a3d4b8608666c5
'}]
commit_message:
Dont raise NotFound in simple db image_tag_get_all

This patch removes the check in simple db. This is so both simple db and
sqlalchemy have the same behavior. We do not necessarily want to perform two
queries to see if the image exists so an empty list of tags is returned.

Fixes bug 1197057

Change-Id: Ibae37198b3854aa5dbe0e8a643a3d4b8608666c5

Do you have a real instance where this was tripped over in the code where we wouldn't want to add that line of spaces?"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-25 17:21:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LGTM, although I am curious to hear the answer to Sean's question."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-26 07:39:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, there are real occurrences within OpenStack project, just try running it e.g. on trove. I'd prefer to fix "real" problems though first instead of annoying everyone on whether or not they should indent a license string or not. This is going imho too far. It would be a matter of a different style check anyway (always enforce a space after the initial "#" sign for example).'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-26 11:10:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

a spot check on trove shows the apache license looks fine on the 3 files I hit randomly. Can you link me a file where it doesn't work."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-26 11:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

trove/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/011_quota.py

basically any file printed by 

fgrep -rl "#Licensed under" .'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-06-26 13:13:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I would argue that's a screw up, completely unreadable, and should be fixed. :)

Also trove is currently ignoring all hacking rules from what I can see, so fixing hacking to deal with trove non compliance isn't something that I think is useful.

[flake8]
show-source = True
ignore = E125,F401,F403,F811,F821,F841,H102,H103,H201,H23,H301,H306,H401,H402,H403,H404,H702,H703
builtins = _
exclude=.venv,.tox,dist,doc,openstack,*egg,rsdns,tools"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-06-26 23:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We can discuss a separate check that verifies if there is a whitespace after the "# ", and actually pep8 does that in most of the cases already (not sure why it doesn't here). 

In any case this is not a warning that the _license_ check should be caring about since it is not a _license_ violation. It might be a pep8 or a whitespace-hacking violation, but thats a matter of a different check. 

Looking at the current list of tox.ini ignores is not useful, check the pending review requests instead. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-04 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-04 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-07-04 09:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored

Still think that whitespace checks belongs to either pep8 or another hacking check (it is not restricted to license at all). Furthermore the license check also ignores multiple whitespaces. and I'd say something like " FOO     BAR BLUBB" is equally unreadable.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-04 09:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

I can see this either way, deferring to sean'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-07-05 14:45:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

It's all over the place, and it drive me crazy. First random file I picked in nova:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/availability_zones.py#L4-14

I agree, though, that checking for and/or fixing the amount of space between the # and the first line of the license is a
different check. The patch to fix it across OpenStack would be large and annoying to people."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-07 22:32:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I agree with Monty.  As the goal of this test is to just ensure the license is present spacing is outside its scope.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-07 22:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-25 09:21:59.000000000', 'message': "Strip leading/trailing whitespace when comparing License

Indentation can be different in the header, that doesn't
change the license. Hence compare with leading and trailing
whitespace removed.

Change-Id: I5d5c5fb67413848073d8ece2a723e98c111df1f1
"}, {'created': '2013-06-25 12:45:31.000000000', 'message': 'Strip leading/trailing whitespace from reference License

Some licenses are not indented at all, thereby missing a
leading space and failing the comparison. Given that
whitespace does not change the meaing of the license, it
is okay to remove it for the check.

Also adjust the print() statement which printed the
reference license as <license> and the actual license
as <apache2>, which is confusing for those who try
to understand what is going on.

Change-Id: I5d5c5fb67413848073d8ece2a723e98c111df1f1
'}]
commit_message:
Strip leading/trailing whitespace from reference License

Some licenses are not indented at all, thereby missing a
leading space and failing the comparison. Given that
whitespace does not change the meaing of the license, it
is okay to remove it for the check.

Also adjust the print() statement which printed the
reference license as <license> and the actual license
as <apache2>, which is confusing for those who try
to understand what is going on.

Change-Id: I5d5c5fb67413848073d8ece2a723e98c111df1f1

commit_message:
Allow changing the collectors that are used.

Positional arguments now specify which collectors to use. This allows
disabling a collector if it is problematic, and also re-ordering of the
emitted $OS_CONFIG_FILES from the default order if necessary.

Change-Id: I7e76db991c0b16c529c1cbf9a1ba9beb78e45482

commit_message:
Directly install requirements with pip

Rather than parsing then feeding the pip requirements file to pip,
just have pip consume it directly.

Change-Id: I17bbe4324e6957c7165bc0f340ddae1e51039471

[{'created': '2013-07-07 16:00:51.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that README file makes it into the tarball

setup.cfg depends on the README file for its long description, so if
it's not in the source tarball, the build will bomb out. README.rst is an
automatically grokked name of a file for python and gets included
automatically. While we're dealing with this, add a MANIFEST.in to
ensure that AUTHORS and ChangeLog get installed too.

Change-Id: Id59fa5a6fecc179a80710ba8a5dc898fb713b1cf
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that README file makes it into the tarball

setup.cfg depends on the README file for its long description, so if
it's not in the source tarball, the build will bomb out. README.rst is an
automatically grokked name of a file for python and gets included
automatically. While we're dealing with this, add a MANIFEST.in to
ensure that AUTHORS and ChangeLog get installed too.

Change-Id: Id59fa5a6fecc179a80710ba8a5dc898fb713b1cf

'deleted') to FixedIp model and migrate sripts.

and `fixed_ip_bulk_create`.

commit_message:
Add unique constraint to FixedIp.

Added unique constraint `uniq_fixed_ips0address0deleted` ('address',
'deleted') to FixedIp model and migrate sripts.
Added new exception `FixedIpExists`. Updated functions `fixed_ip_create`
and `fixed_ip_bulk_create`.
Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-31 09:46:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed coluns list in indexes.

Migration 152 change type of `deleted` column from Boolean to table.id.type
for all tables. Also (as side effect) this migration removed column `deleted`

commit_message:
Fixed columns list in indexes.

Migration 152 changed the type of `deleted` column from Boolean to
table.id.type for all tables. Also (as side effect) this migration
removed column `deleted` from indexes (in MySQL) or removed whole
indexes (in PostgreSQL). Current migration fixes these indexes.

Fixes bug 1191724

Change-Id: I3d95d102f379c3817bb372fefb1b12cf5de8a4db

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry I couldn't understand intension of this patch.
I got intension of the blueprint.

So which code specifies LBaaS and L3 is part of core plugins?"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Nachi, intention of this patch was to show one possible approach to implement the blue print. As you can see, code is far from being ready.

As for the code that specifies that former extensions are part of the plugin: in this patch there's no such code. 
In fact I just added some code to api router to process resources in the same way extension manager does it.
I have planned to move 'extension' file somewhere to api/v2/... Other than that extension code itself could be reused.

The general intention of moving extension to core is to be able to add extensions to new core API, for lbaas, for example."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-07 13:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Move lbaas extension to core API

implement blueprint api-core-for-services

Let core API router load lbaas extension instead of Extension Framework

Change-Id: Icc57ae0728c2b4c457da015701ee045ac59618e5

'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-05-24 07:33:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can you please reconsider the approach of using the scheduler as a proxy since this will go in the opposite direction of bp/query-scheduler. Here, the scheduler is being reduced to just handle scheduling queries and we should not add more proxying methods to it, but instead hand of the work to the conductor.

See:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova+branch:master+topic:bp/query-scheduler,n,z 
and also
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova+branch:master+topic:bp/live-migration-to-conductor,n,z"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-05-29 10:11:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Yes, that scheduler stuff is so close now, its probably worth waiting for it to land first.

It would be nice to see api->conductor (compute task API), then conductor calls compute (like we do in the api today), with optional call to scheduler before that, to discover the host for that call to compute.

The above should really simplify things, I think.

Sorry, its just unlucky timing really. We are half way through all these changes."}, {'account_id': 2667, 'date': '2013-05-29 11:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

My 2 cents.. IMO, it is better to merge this the way it is, and then add another patch that follows the broader refactoring around scheduling (queries, conductor, etc).'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-05-31 21:28:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-03 09:26:32.000000000', 'message': "Evacuate instance to a scheduled host

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt.
This API call locates a suitable host within the same cell (using nova-scheduler), and performs an update of the instance's location to the new host (similar to a rebuild).
This call is only available to users with the Admin role.

Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance
Change-Id: I950b958d3070d877540873398d6d6f90c84cfc61

commit_message:
Evacuate instance to a scheduled host

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt. This
API call locates a suitable host within the same
cell (using nova-scheduler), and performs an update of the
instance's location to the new host (similar to a rebuild). This
call is only available to users with the Admin role.

Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance
Change-Id: I950b958d3070d877540873398d6d6f90c84cfc61

commit_message:
Put some order on os-refresh-config systemd

cloud-init is populating the file /var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-init-data
with metadata and needs to happen before os-refresh-config is run
which in turn needs to happen before the cfn-hup cronjob.

Change-Id: I07fc60c4a165a42eeae1a8e5a20609a6e17fd790

commit_message:
Stop patching the GenericResource's property_schema

This is causing test failures if you add a new test
and don't reset the scema to {}, this seems to be timing
related. Just add Resource types that we need prevents the
need for this patching.

Change-Id: If7ddd2b1ffa8b54025c0369fe8c4f7440f0e3cdc

commit_message:
Fix inconsistency between Nova-Net and Quantum

The quantum client raises QuantumClientException (status_code 409)
that is not unknown for nova, and is translated in 500 computeFault.
Catching this exception in nova/nova/network/quantumv2/api.py and
raising it as exception.NoMoreFloatingIps solves the problem.

Handle exception if floating ip pool is not found

Change-Id: I290bc8b58e13195c2ee50ea9063c0dbedc4c414a
Fixes: bug #1194460

Fixes bug 1194274

Change-Id: If41c64672f566ce381a3954b69351c8187b6ca0b
'}]
commit_message:
Import WritableLogger from oslo

glance/common/wsgi.py contains a WritableLogger, the same code can be
imported from oslo.

Set the logging level to DEBUG to match current behaviour (oslo uses
INFO by default).

Fixes bug 1194274

Change-Id: If41c64672f566ce381a3954b69351c8187b6ca0b

commit_message:
Add cinder cleanup to migrations.

After deep review actual db state and models i found
few tables in database skipped in db.models.
After moving of cinder in separate project these tables
were not removed.

Tables for deletion:
- sm_flavors
- sm_backend_config
- sm_volume
- virtual_storage_arrays
- volume_metadata
- volume_types
- volume_type_extra_specs
- shadow_sm_flavors
- shadow_sm_backend_config
- shadow_sm_volume
- shadow_virtual_storage_arrays
- shadow_volume_metadata
- shadow_volume_types
- shadow_volume_type_extra_specs

Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I67e9f643419b1f43e544837c5e89470d274cd7ae

I'm also concerned about the real purpose of nova::rabbitmq.

Will people really setup a RabbitMQ installation dedicated to Nova? Shouldn't it goes in puppet-openstack instead? I fear people will want a rabbitmq class in each modules and replicate changes in all of them each time which would result in useless duplicated works. commit_message:
Adds support for RabbitMQ Clustering

Prior to this change, only a single RabbitMQ Broker
could be deployed by the nova::rabbitmq class.

This change implements the cluster_disk_nodes parameter
that can enable RabbitMQ clustering.

Defaults to false for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Iac2d04e855adb53fbb9fe2a23f8773a692162744

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 20:37:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add Quantum metadata proxy documentation

Document metadata_agent.ini - includes auth_* and admin_* flags needed
for the Quantum client as the metadata agent does not seem to be able
to read these from quantum.conf even though it is on the command line.
Removed section in advanced config options about the need for
additional routing as this no longer applies.

Fixes bug 1099573

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/34576

Change-Id: I2f5b73d5a6bd2add27f9dd46ad2ca1d6db832b1c
'}]
commit_message:
Add Quantum metadata proxy documentation

Document metadata_agent.ini - includes auth_* and admin_* flags needed
for the Quantum client as the metadata agent does not seem to be able
to read these from quantum.conf even though it is on the command line.
Removed section in advanced config options about the need for
additional routing as this no longer applies.

Fixes bug 1099573

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/34576

Change-Id: I2f5b73d5a6bd2add27f9dd46ad2ca1d6db832b1c

commit_message:
Rename Quantum to Neutron

This change renames everything to Neutron while providing backwards
compatible adjustments for Grizzly configuration files.

implements blueprint: remove-use-of-quantum

Change-Id: Ie7d07ba7c89857e13d4ddc8f0e9b68de020a3d19

commit_message:
Install nova networking from neutron repository

Fixes bug 1198547

The repository location has been moved nothing else, lots more will
eventually need to be renamed from quantum in this element but for
now this is enough to keep things working.

Change-Id: Ib633e91db76bb6ba785ba572e3c64d44426307ae

commit_message:
Clear out before connecting.

Since the node set may have been altered since the
last connect we want to make sure clear out the
edges and the providers of items before connecting.

Change-Id: I73e6b3bc5d83a82d2b13dbb6b06c66e794d66e9c

commit_message:
Pass runners instead of task objects/uuids.

Runners contain tasks and provide the identifying
characteristics for the tasks, pass these along to
the underlying components instead of tasks.

Change-Id: I795a52d3a218e508c38ea209d757750ae6a936ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-25 20:00:58.000000000', 'message': 'Move how resuming is done to be disconnected from jobs/flows.

Instead of having resuming tied to a job allow a workflow to
have a resumption strategy object that will split its initial
work order into 2 segments. One that has finished previously
and one that has not finished previously. Refactor the code that
previously tied a single resumption strategy to the job class
and move it to a more generic resumption module folder.

Change-Id: I8709cd6cb7a9deecefe8d2927be517a00acb422d

commit_message:
Move how resuming is done to be disconnected from jobs/flows.

Instead of having resuming tied to a job allow a workflow to
have a resumption strategy object that will split its initial
work order into 2 segments. One that has finished previously
and one that has not finished previously. Refactor the code that
previously tied a single resumption strategy to the job class
and move it to a more generic resumption module folder.

Change-Id: I8709cd6cb7a9deecefe8d2927be517a00acb422d

commit_message:
Configure glance-cache.conf with file backend

glance::backend::file was not properly configuring
filesystem_store_datadir in /etc/glance/glance-cache.conf
when using file backend.

Change-Id: Ie8d3259de429089f2f00fbafd2e5cbf90c069263

commit_message:
Configure glance-cache.conf with swift backend

glance::backend::swift was not properly configuring
swift_store_* in /etc/glance/glance-cache.conf
when using swift backend.

Change-Id: I7b46dd2bd1ff050759b11cbc9c3c7068e4c3e01e

subject: adding hypervisors panel to admin dashboard
messages:
[{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-07-04 10:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Christian, thank you for the patch! It looks good to me. Could you open a bug for this and update the commit message with the bug number (e.g. "Fixes bug #1234")? We prefer patches to be associated with bugs, for easier tracking. I'm happy to +2 once that's done.

Also, for future reference, I think it is better in these cases to reopen the old review and continue there.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18308/

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-04 10:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-04 10:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ok, looks like that last one requires a rebase to be reproduced locally, "Enable H306 check" was only merged yesterday (59ef565871). Note that what is considered alphabetical order can be kind of weird because it's based on module names. For instance this is incorrect:

from django import http
from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse

commit_message:
adding hypervisors panel to admin dashboard

This commit adds a new panel "Hypervisors" to the system panel in
the admin dashboard listing all registered hypervisors hosts by
using the os-hypervisors extension of the Nova API.

fixes bug #1197763

Change-Id: I3f9a7858342c3592521b7fa8ecf17e2fb5af6cda

commit_message:
Make connection/validation of tasks be after they are added.

Instead of having validation be immediate when tasks are added
to the linear flow, follow the same paradigm as the graph_flow
where only upon connection (or determination of the order) will
tasks be connected/validated.

Change-Id: Ia8275ec88b0229f0793819249ae59fad0a2e9935

commit_message:
Add helper to do notification

Instead of embedding the notification calls into the
ordered flow object provide a better util helper class that
can be used to accomplish the notification registration
and activation.

Change-Id: Ia4d21cb126e8ac12c227a5c0aca467d96daa3987

commit_message:
Various Puppet lint fixes

* Fix following warnings:
    * class not documented
    * double quoted string containing no variables
    * indentation of => is not properly aligned
    * string containing only a variable
    * top-scope variable being used without an explicit namespace
* Fix following error:
    * two-space soft tabs not used

Change-Id: I709b30e3d80c7cd3b22080a8c096a23342f75d2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 06:57:34.000000000', 'message': 'Store results by add() uuid instead of in array format.

Instead of storing the results in the previous linear
format, just store the results indexed by the uuid
returned from the add() method instead. This allows
for easier access to individual task result as well
as makes it easier to support non-linear result
insertation.

Change-Id: Id7461cb74eb1a380b05cf23643e7120df5682224
'}, {'created': '2013-06-29 02:19:22.000000000', 'message': 'Store results by add() uuid instead of in array format.

commit_message:
Store results by add() uuid instead of in array format.

Instead of storing the results in the previous linear
format, just store the results indexed by the uuid
returned from the add() method instead. This allows
for easier access to individual task result as well
as makes it easier to support non-linear result
insertation.

Change-Id: Id7461cb74eb1a380b05cf23643e7120df5682224

commit_message:
Add direct depend on hgtools.

hgtools is a dependecy that's found in pytest-runner which is only
a setup_requirement. This means that easy_install installs it into
a temporary location and pip never knows.

Change-Id: I84b0f830b4fada25ddcd6d4a94a15a157ccc7a7a

Ensure that when a linear flow is running that it can
not be modified by another thread at the same time it
is running by putting a lock around sensitive functions.

Also instead of using the raw task objects themselves
integrate a helper runner class that can automatically
find the needed inputs for the contained task and which
also stores the result of the task. This is useful so
that additional functionality can be provided to the task
without the task being aware of said activity.

commit_message:
Integrate better locking and a runner helper class.

Ensure that when a linear flow or derivatives is running
that it can not be modified by another thread at the same
time it is running by putting a lock around sensitive functions.

Also instead of using the raw task objects themselves
integrate a helper 'runner' class that provides useful
functionality that occurs before its tasks runs as well
as member variables that are associated with the contained
task.

This helper class currently provides the following:

- A uuid that can be returned to callers of the add
  method to identify there task (and later its results),
  allowing for multiple of the same tasks to be added.
- Automatic extraction of the needed required and optional
  inputs for the contained task.

Change-Id: Ib01939a4726155a629e4b4703656b9067868d8f3

commit_message:
Adding jinja2 for templating config files.

The trove project generates configuration files for installation
of datastore services, and modifies said files upon resizes of
servers, and this is templated and generated via jinja2.

Change-Id: Ifa2aa225b1b0739979a15b3a8e75944567e3b577

commit_message:
Add a version to pytz.

Upcoming improvements to pip 1.4 (wheel support and
skip-pre-release-by-default) mean that pytz without a version
will be skipped. Adding a version here gets us what we want.

Adding an intial lower-bound on the version that's currently in RHEL6,
since we don't actually care about the version itself.

pytz uses date based versioning which isn't supported by default:

http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/#date-based-versions

Change-Id: Ieb0cda61b2f8665d5f83ff8beb8a4cf5b4ece011

commit_message:
Handle empty arglists in Filters

The various filters either asserted or incorrectly
assumed that an empty arglist matched the filter.
Add testcases to avoid regressions.

Change-Id: If90fbad3d54749ecc645071675402ea2613870a2

[{'created': '2013-07-06 02:01:08.000000000', 'message': "Stop using distribute in install_venv_common

Upstream distribute is dead and has been merged back into setuptools.
Additionally, enhancements have been made to both setuptools and pip
that mean we no longer have to carry hacks around versions.

Also, we don't need to install greenlet here. Order is respected in
requirements.txt.

Also, let's kill the pip_requires verbage.

Change-Id: Ia15c66d6a03522e804ff96fd6f8d81db00467a6e
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using distribute in install_venv_common

Upstream distribute is dead and has been merged back into setuptools.
Additionally, enhancements have been made to both setuptools and pip
that mean we no longer have to carry hacks around versions.

Also, we don't need to install greenlet here. Order is respected in
requirements.txt.

Also, let's kill the pip_requires verbage.

Change-Id: Ia15c66d6a03522e804ff96fd6f8d81db00467a6e

commit_message:
Update paths to pem files in keystone.conf.sample

Location of *.pem files were changed without synchronization with
keystone.conf.sample.

Change-Id: I99a61230b06eb43046e543c0d0663c49aa21d558
Fixes: bug #1197743

This needs to be properly cherry picked, the change IDs don't line up when you don't do a proper cherry pick with the -x option. This makes it harder to find the original fix on master.  When you do a cherry pick with the -x option, the change ID matches that of the original fix and then in Gerrit if you want to look at the original (or other cherry picks from the original), all you have to do is click the Change-Id link in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2013-06-28 17:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

commit_message:
Using unicode() to handle image's properties

Replace str() to unicode() to allow nova-api work well with the fix Zhi
Yan Liu did in glanceclient (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29245/6).

Fixes: Bug #1180377

Change-Id: I75dd7bbfcc1619dab5ed9245956d4b6c5f92167e
(cherry picked from commit 832a66cf0bd8f7ccb0878889174c1ce4da7f42f3)

subject: Improve update.py module behaviour.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-05 19:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/31843/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1948 : SUCCESS in 1m 40s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/31843/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/1723/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31843/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/1572 : SUCCESS in 1m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31843/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/1907 : SUCCESS in 3m 51s
- http://logs.openstack.org/31843/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1908 : SUCCESS in 3m 34s
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-06 15:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What happens if you run:

  $> python update.py --dest-dir ../nova --base nova --module fileutils

Does it remove all of the other modules?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-06 15:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

See also https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo#Syncing_Code_from_Incubator'}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-06-06 17:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, it removes unset modules. In the case if project is using openstack-common.conf file with lines like:

modules=setup, jsonutils, xmlutils, ........

this will be done automatically after running the following command:

 ./update.sh ../path/to/project

This behaviour, as I understand, was wished in the https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo/+bug/1181630

Do you have some other thoughts on this moment?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-06 21:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Well, as you can see from the wiki page, I actually recommend that people selectively sync modules rather than syncing all modules listed in openstack-common.conf

i.e. we need this command line to keep working as before:

   $> python update.py --dest-dir ../nova --base nova --module fileutils"}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-06-07 05:03:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll look what can be done :)"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-14 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-14 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-06-14 06:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Restored

I'll continue working on this bag."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-06-14 08:11:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm a bit hesitant about this feature. 

What would happen with module's dependencies? 

Would it be fair to verify if the dependencies of the module being removed are still needed in the project - if other modules depend on them, for example - ?

If no, the user will have to clean up dependencies itself so, why bothering with this feature?

Cheers,
FF"}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-06-14 09:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If several modules have the same dependencies and one of them is removed, dependencies have to be left. This is implemented in the part of building dependencies tree of the modules in the update.py file.

I suppose, there will be the following behaviour:
1) update using the configuration project file
    1.1 if modules removed from oslo, remove them from project
    1.2 if modules removed from conf file, remove them from project
2) update with params passed through CLI - work only with these modules (do not delete unpassed modules)
    2.1 if module is wanted to be updated and it was removed from oslo, remove it
    2.2 if module is wanted to be updated and there are no issues in oslo with it update it'}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-06-14 09:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 09:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

I'm really hesitant about this too

In fact, I'd almost prefer to remove the automatic dependency handling rather than add this additional complexity. Additional complexity has its cost here - I want people to understand exactly what this script is doing and this code makes it much harder for them to do that

People running this script should know what code is being updated and know what changes are in the update. I'd almost prefer if they had to explicitly list dependencies and manually do removals

The script is just a quick hack to help people - the main thing it does is e.g. s/openstack.common/nova.openstack.common/

Thanks for all the work on this, but I really just don't think this is going in the right direction

Would like to hear from other oslo-core folks though"}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2013-06-18 07:47:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Improve update.py module behaviour.

Fixes: bug #1181630

Fix the following moments:
    * there was no reaction if some module was deleted from project
      configuration file (this module was not deleted)
    * if some module was removed from oslo, it was not removed from
      project while running the update
    * if CLI was used to pass exact modules to update, only they have
      to be updated (other modules should not be deleted)

Change-Id: I69fd6111926b80044cbd611b2f09b50e670b475b

subject: Controller Callbacks
messages:
[{'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-06-28 20:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-06-28 20:48:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I prefer WSGIContext, but that's just personal preference.  I don't like having two ways to do the same thing, but it may just be that everyone should do *this* instead.  

I do think it would be better to make the callback chain a list; if the proxy calls all the callbacks in order there's less places things can go wrong with a broken callback chain.

But IMHO it'd be best to not do it at all and conform to standard WSGI convention for modifying the response."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-28 21:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-06-28 20:16:15.000000000', 'message': 'Controller Callbacks

A callback mechanism was added to allow middleware to register
callbacks from a/c/o controllers allowing easier core swift
extendiability by middleware.

The callback takes the form:
      resp = controller_callback(req, resp)

Any middleware using the callback mechanism should chain
its callback to previous callbacks - i.e. it is tasked to
call any other callback it replaces when adding itself.

DocImpact

Bug: #1195861
Change-Id: I7ef756cb7030e1189a0ba74da5b3cf689969b2c6

commit_message:
Controller Callbacks

A callback mechanism was added to allow middleware to register
callbacks from a/c/o controllers allowing easier core swift
extendiability by middleware.

The callback takes the form:
      resp = controller_callback(req, resp)

Any middleware using the callback mechanism should chain
its callback to previous callbacks - i.e. it is tasked to
call any other callback it replaces when adding itself.

DocImpact

Bug: #1195861
Change-Id: I7ef756cb7030e1189a0ba74da5b3cf689969b2c6

(1 inline comment)

So, I find this patch rather confusing. I think part of it is that the commit comment just restates the text of the patch, but doesn't give intent. What's this *do*? In what way does the movement of data in a cluster change, and what problem does that solve? 

Things like "add function get_outdated_node" aren't particularly helpful in deciphering the intent of a patch. (Also, there isn't actually any get_outdated_node function added, so now you've got two problems.)

Also, as a general note, I don't like having the region filtering in the Ring class. If you want nodes in a particular region only, do the filtering where you need it.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 16:43:16.000000000', 'message': 'Implementation cross-region replication.

* Introduce region in get_more_nodes behaviour.
* Add get_part_nodes_region into Ring class.
* Add parameter max_local_replication into replicate algorithm;
* Add counter for number of replication pass;
* Add function get_outdated_node;
* Update replication algorithm for primary nodes:
    - Update remote nodes one in max_local_replication passes,
    - Update only one remote node in one pass.

Change-Id: I040aa4e7d5db9c74f89fbded882040637844d7ad

commit_message:
Implementation cross-region replication.

* Introduce region in get_more_nodes behaviour.
* Add get_part_nodes_region into Ring class.
* Add parameter max_local_replication into replicate algorithm;
* Add counter for number of replication pass;
* Add function get_outdated_node;
* Update replication algorithm for primary nodes:
    - Update remote nodes one in max_local_replication passes,
    - Update only one remote node in one pass.

Change-Id: I040aa4e7d5db9c74f89fbded882040637844d7ad
Implements: blueprint multi-region

a snapshot exists.  This implements the incorrectly

Change-Id: Ia0f6cbd3d5b4561c5368545448abaafa67caf05d
'}]
commit_message:
Add check for snapshot to Brick LVM.

Adds a check to the LVM code in brick to see if
a snapshot exists.  This implements the incorrectly
named "is_busy" method that exists in the cinder LVM driver.

Change-Id: Ia0f6cbd3d5b4561c5368545448abaafa67caf05d

Add oslo.sphinx

Allow projects to use the new oslo.sphinx version of the OpenStack
doc theme instead of copying it into each repo.

blueprint oslo.sphinx

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Enable H304 hacking check

The error was:

'import install_venv_common as install_venv' is a relative import

To fix it __init__.py was created and import string was fixed.

Requirements for hacking changed to >=0.5.6

Change-Id: I71aa7c7cb268c26aa00828306138a84b30289cb9

subject: config.generator: replace sys.prefix by /usr

commit_message:
config.generator: replace sys.prefix by /usr

Nova has some default configuration option (bindir) value that uses
sys.prefix as path start. That can generates weird paths depending on
the system where you run the configuration generator.

This patch fixes that by hardcoding a replacement of sys.prefix to /usr,
which is what's actually expected most of the time.

Change-Id: Ied3b58695965a3102670e3761701fbe10ac74785
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Bug # 1198273 - Add EPEL repository to assumptions.

Added EPEL repository to instructions and modified RDO instruction to
use a consistent approach (using the "release" RPM). Also fixed prompt
which erroneously indicated normal user could write to /etc/yum.repos.d.

Change-Id: I706b74594212a73aeecd229d2fce7f5244f555b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 00:37:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loop0p2 does not exist on F19

On Fedora 19, there is a delay between the time loop0p2
is created to the time it is ready to be mounted.

This patches waits for 5 seconds for /dev/mapper/loop0p2
to be accessible. If it is not ready then the script
exits with status 1.

Fixes: bug #1197340

Change-Id: Iff0cfd0566673799a77500e0e24954f5f3743a17
'}]
commit_message:
Fix loop0p2 does not exist on F19

On Fedora 19, there is a delay between the time loop0p2
is created to the time it is ready to be mounted.

This patches waits for 5 seconds for /dev/mapper/loop0p2
to be accessible. If it is not ready then the script
exits with status 1.

Fixes: bug #1197340

Change-Id: Iff0cfd0566673799a77500e0e24954f5f3743a17

- http://logs.openstack.org/34900/1/check/gate-tripleo-image-elements-python27/448 : SUCCESS in 37s
'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm going to disagree with Clint here. virtualenvs provide isolation - and we can and should expect such bugs in the future. Yes it's critical, but we should engineer for robustness, no?

On the performance side, perhaps its time we picked up the deferred 'how do we cache everything' concept and say 'well it seems relevant now' ?"}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hmm, so I see that as an argument against doing this.

That is a critical bug in d2to1 and pbr, and apparently oslo. IMO it is also a critical bug in neutron that it depends on an unreleased oslo.config.

So, the massive sweeping change of not using --system-site-packages is really a workaround to try and avoid this problem, but it will introduce longer build times and less stable plumbing-we-dont-control-it software into the virtualenvs.

I would propose problems like that one be solved with:

# Remove after lp bug #1194742 is fixed.
$venv/bin/pip install oslo.config==1.2.0a2

And perhaps even add an "also affects" to that bug so we can monitor the progress.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, lifeless promises to hold my hand through the dark and stormy nights, so this doesn't scare me anymore."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The idea behind using --system-site-packages is that the bits in the system site-packages are pure plumbing and don't need to be special cased inside a virtualenv per-service. It is still a huge benefit to have everything in a virtualenv so that individual libraries can be tailored to meet requirements without affecting other things on the system.

Seems to me that if there are things not working inside a virtualenv that also has system-site-packages, those are bugs in the upstream requirements.txt.

Perhaps I am missing a case where that is not true though. Can you reference a problem this is meant to solve?"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Clint,

It's meant to fix problems like this: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1194807"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

libmysqlclient-dev needs to be mapped on fedora'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34901/ should land first!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 00:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/34900/1/gate/gate-tripleo-image-elements-python27/523 : SUCCESS in 27s
