Change-Id: Ifc3580d4b59a5f1e97de77c0c4a875b123208100

commit_message:
Use --no-site-package for services venv's (-nova)

The --system-site-packages option essentially removes the benefits of
virtualenv, nova is a special case because it depends on python-libvirt
which can't be installed via pip.

Change-Id: Ifc3580d4b59a5f1e97de77c0c4a875b123208100

commit_message:
Add lbaas support for Openstack Network (Neutron).

* Add support of quantum lbaas.
* A lot of variables moved to attributes.
* Fix syntax bugs in l3_agent.
* Fix bugs and extend metadata_agent template.
* Add create template action for metadata_agent.
* Add reference stranerfile for ci.
* Add rspec tests for balancer recipe.
 identity-endpoint.

Change-Id: Ieb6172417ed63cb8323c011e28d6f490c0a8bd19

Add directory creation for /etc/cinder

Ensure /etc/cinder exists before trying
to create /etc/cinder/cinder.conf

fixes lp 1197930

Change-Id: I372603b56f0e4fd284f65f29b6260bb3c53289b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 21:49:31.000000000', 'message': 'The "arg_value" was not getting checked for empty list.

In the _merge_args function it is possible that "arg_value" which is
an instance of a list can be an empty list. We still want to append
"value" which is also an instance of list (passed as part of "_extra_values"
argument) to it. arg_value was not getting checked for empty list.

Fixes bug #1108365

Change-Id: Iec73fee822fd3f3e5741e374b0a45bcff7157b5d
'}]
commit_message:
The "arg_value" was not getting checked for empty list.

In the _merge_args function it is possible that "arg_value" which is
an instance of a list can be an empty list. We still want to append
"value" which is also an instance of list (passed as part of "_extra_values"
argument) to it. arg_value was not getting checked for empty list.

Fixes bug #1108365

Change-Id: Iec73fee822fd3f3e5741e374b0a45bcff7157b5d

commit_message:
Make EC2 API request objects instead of converting them.

Now that compute_api can return them, we can simplify
this a bit.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I4c60e913974d8a2d63258d4f63cc988786893089

subject: Make instance show and index use objects

lazy-loading 'fault' is not an option for the get_all() case.... since it would cause N extra queries.  But it seems like there's enough other uses of get() and get_all() that we should not query for 'fault' by default... because that's a lot of extra places we'll be doing 1 more DB query over what's happening today.

I think I'd lean towards adding a expected_attrs to get() and get_all() or something :-/"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-07-02 15:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-02 16:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Works for me

commit_message:
Make instance show and index use objects

This makes compute_api return instance objects for its
get() and get_all() methods. The necessary changes to
nova-api's compute/servers are included, which are
pretty minor. Most of the change in this patch is making
the tests do the right thing after the switch to objects.

Also, make a mostly-unrelated typo fix in
obj_to_primitive() which was missed in a previous review.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I08dddd311f061e3b39df953b1c8f21f778603770

commit_message:
Bug 1099573 Add Quantum metadata proxy documentation

Document metadata_agent.ini - includes auth_* and admin_* flags needed for
the Qauntum client as the metadata agent does not seem to be able to read
these from quantum.conf even though it is on the command line.
Removed section in advanced config options about the need for additional
routing as this no longer applies.

Change-Id: I2f5b73d5a6bd2add27f9dd46ad2ca1d6db832b1c

[{'created': '2013-06-28 22:04:26.000000000', 'message': "Make flavors is_public option actually work

When you create a flavor, you can set an is_public flag to be True or
False.  It is True by default.  When False, the intention is that the
flavor is only accessible by an admin.

Unfortunately, the only place in the code where this was being enforced
was when listing flavors through the API.  It would filter out the
non-public ones for a non-admin.  Otherwise, the flavor was accessible.
You could get the details, and you could boot an instance with it, if
you figured out a valid flavor ID.

This patch adds enforcement down in the db layer.  It also fixes one
place in the API where the context wasn't passed down to enable the
enforcement to happen.

Fix bug 1194093.

Change-Id: I5b37fa0bb19683fe1642fd81222547d4a317054e

commit_message:
Make flavors is_public option actually work

When you create a flavor, you can set an is_public flag to be True or
False.  It is True by default.  When False, the intention is that the
flavor is only accessible by an admin, unless you use the flavor_access
API extension to grant access to specific tenants.

Unfortunately, the only place in the code where this was being enforced
was when listing flavors through the API.  It would filter out the
non-public ones for a non-admin.  Otherwise, the flavor was accessible.
You could get the details, and you could boot an instance with it, if
you figured out a valid flavor ID.

This patch adds enforcement down in the db layer.  It also fixes one
place in the API where the context wasn't passed down to enable the
enforcement to happen.

Fix bug 1194093.

Change-Id: I5b37fa0bb19683fe1642fd81222547d4a317054e
